reviews.title: Love It!
reviews.body: This lighter brings back many fond memories of my Mom from 50 years ago.  She always used a Zippo.  The smell is quite nostalgic for me.  The first one arrived without a wick, but Amazon replaced it super quick.  The new one works perfectly.  Hope to get many years of use out of this one.

reviews.title: Fluid evaporates rapidly, so it never lights when I want it too.
Love It!
reviews.body: What more can I say? Classic Zippo Chrome Lighter. Works like a charm. Just wanted to get one just for the heck of it. Classic sleek and small enough to carry around anywhere. Yea it scratches up, but what do you expect from something made out of chrome? I think it adds character to your lighter actually. Sure you can purchase those disposable lighters that can hold more lighter fluid than this Zippo, but it ain't as good looking as a Zippo. If you want something that looks classy and potentially last forever get this! Its the most reliable lighter you can get in the market. Just make sure to trim the flint when it gets too burnt.

author.name: ByIsland Hopper

reviews.title: Another great classic. I dont think you can get a more dependable yet stylish and also american made lighter than this.
reviews.body:
Bought this for my hubby. Who continuously looses them.
Works great. Nice weight. Good in the wind.
And the best part is hubby still has it!! Has not lost this one.
Oh and they do take a beating. Hubby has ran it over with the loaded semi and just got a small dent. Surprised him and me. Hubby expected it to be broken. It did hold up to all the abuse of the semi with flatbed trailer loaded with a coil of steel. Would recommend to anyone needing a flame. We only use Zippo brand flames, flints and fluid.

reviews.title: Classic Style Lighter!
reviews.body:
Simple, sturdy, refillable, replaceable wick... stamped "BRADFORD, PA. MADE IN U.S.A." which is always nice to see. :-)

What's not to like? I've had and lost a few Zippos over the years... but I've never had one break or fail. Just have to remember to top them off regularly with lighter fuel, which is quick and easy to do. The fuel is the standard-issue stuff like Ronsonol Lighter Fuel you can get at hardware stores and gas stations, and it's pretty cheap if you buy a larger container. The 12oz Zippo brand fuel available on Amazon is also a pretty decent deal--that's quite a few refills and will last a while unless you like using your Zippo as a lantern to read by or something. Which probably wouldn't hurt the lighter any... might get hot, though.

If you're not prone to losing things like I am, a lighter like this one might save you a bit of money over its life vs buying replaceable ones or matches all the time.

Be aware that these lighters are not pressurized like a butane lighter. So the flame does not "jet" out the tip. It's more like a portable candle. So it blows out easily, and if you hold it at crazy angles it might burn your hand. I mostly use it for starting campfires, lanterns and candles, and as a backup portable light source. At those kinds of tasks it is ideal.

author.name: ByMr.Fish

reviews.title: Works great. Nice weight. Good in the wind.
reviews.body:
Zippo Street Chrome Pocket Lighter
Zippo lighters are among the most dependable and long-lasting products on the market, well deserving five stars. Also deserving five stars is the impressive delivery service. I ordered this item on June 21, 2017 and received it today, June 23, 2017. Two-day delivery is impressive!

reviews.title: Nice for the price
reviews.body:
I bought my first Zippo about 15 years ago, and they were made in USA. This new one is almost exactly alike and still made in USA! It is great to see nothing has really changed other than the packaging. Instead of a cool re-usable plastic flip case, it's a box that probably won't last very long. The internal construction and design is the same.

Overall: 5/5 stars

author.name: Byitalianshoes007

reviews.title: Five stars for the product and five stars for the prompt delivery!
reviews.body: Quit smoking 33 yrs ago but had to have this for its collectible value.  Same quality as the original I purchased in 1952.  Used to dribble residual gas from the pump in the service sta. to fill the thing.  Leaded gas was not known to be unsafe back then.  Gave the original away when I went to work for Scripto in '73.  We made the Vutane (Butane Gas) lighters that competed somewhat with Zippo.

reviews.title: Same great product design and quality, made in America!
reviews.body:
I always keep this lighter fueled up whenever I get the chance. The herringbone texture is great to avoid smudging after a rough night out, and everyone loves the click of a Zippo!
Might need a bit of adjusting (wick placement, cotton placement, flint replacement) but it's just the nature of having an old classic!

author.name: ByKarla R. Moore

reviews.title: Best of the lighters
reviews.body:
I got the street chrome version and it's genuine as far as I can tell. The finish is really nice, and the quality is above my expectations.
Don't forget to reroute your wick when you get it. Search on youtube for "What you should do with your new zippo lighter" on the "Zippo_Norway" channel.

reviews.title: Love It!
reviews.body:
I was hoping that this model would be more like the old Zippo that had a hinge built strong enough you felt you could hang a door from a few. Unfortunately that isn't the case. The hinge, while better than some I've seen in recent years, is nowhere near the quality of the old lighters.

Still, this is the best you can buy new today. Much thicker than the others, the finish isn't rubbing off or horribly scratched after the first few days, and it lights up just like it should.

Four stars, can't bring myself to give it five as it's not as good as they once were, but you're probably not going to find a better option without spending a lot of time rummaging through swap meets and antique stores.

reviews.title: Fluid evaporates rapidly, so it never lights when I want it too.
reviews.body: I thought I'd keep a cool old-fashioned lighter around for occasional use.  I've used it maybe once or twice a month, but had to refill it every single time (five or six times so far).  I'm using good quality fluid, too.  Now I google around and see that this is not uncommon.  A waste of time and money.

reviews.title: Wobbly hinge
reviews.body: I picked this up when it was on sale.  I like the brushed/scratched chrome look so this was perfect for my needs.  I filled it up with Zippo fluid and it lit on the first strike.  Like any Zippo product it's high quality and built here in the USA.

author.name: ByLiam Phoenix

reviews.title: Fluid evaporates rapidly, so it never lights when I want it too.
reviews.body: Standard brushed chrome Zippo, its hard to even review because everyone knows how iconic they are. I had no issues with mine once it was worn in which took about a week of regular use. I love that cling sound when you open the lid! The packaging was a standard bubble wrap mailer and the hard plastic container that a regular Zippo would come in. It was quite goo and mailed VERY fast. Excellent!

reviews.title: It's a Zippo, it's made in the USA and it does it job
reviews.body: Works great and I won't be contributing to the plastic island floating in the Pacific, I hope, lol.  No complaints.  Easy to use, refill, and replace the flint and wick.  I was a bit worried this would be a bit tricky but it really is easy and no I am very attached to it.  It makes using the bics seem like a hassle.

author.name: ByCaptain Cuttle

reviews.title: Perfect.
reviews.body:
I'm not a smoker, but my a gentleman should carry three things in his pockets; a knife, a notebook with a pen, and a lighter. Of course, I could have gone to the gas station and picked up a $0.99 BIC lighter to carry around, but I really believe in the importance of buying things that last and that you can be proud of.

So I went for this, the coolest lighter around.

The stainless steel exterior is simple and very cool. I don't mind lighting someone's cigarette with it, and when they see the steel and hear that nice crisp sound when I flick it open, they are always impressed. The lighter sparks up and lights easily, and the flame is always nice and strong.

The fuel will evaporate slowly, of course, but a can of Zippo fuel is fairly cheap, and it's a small price to pay for having this great lighter in my pocket.

If you're looking around for a simple, elegant lighter...this is it.

reviews.title: Great Long Lasting Easy to Maintain Lighter  Cheaper option to the disposables too
reviews.body: A Zippo is a zippo is a zippo.  Zippos work, and when they get worn out and won't work anymore, zippo will replace the "innards", shine the lighter case up a bit, and send it back to you for FREE.  This zippo is a simple, silver lighter that will look good just the way it is.  If you wanted, you could get this engraved on either side, or even paint a design on it.  It worked the first time we used it, and it continues to work.  Definitely recommend zippo lighters!

author.name: ByM. Prindle

reviews.title: Classic Zippo: Makes Me Feel Like A True Gentleman
reviews.body: Looks cool, but the fluid dries out in just 3-4 days making the lighter useless if you don't refill it frequently. I often will pick it up to use it and find that the fluid is dry. The style is not worth the frustration of having a dry lighter every time I go to use it. I'll switch to a butane lighter.

reviews.title: Zippos are the BEST
reviews.body: Just received this zippo and it does not appear to be brand new. The outside is as described, but the inside shows some wear, as well as on the metal insert. However, the wick, wheel, flint and inner packing are new. I am pretty sure this is refurbished. Perhaps they just buff the outside to give it the worn look to remove any sign of wear or a previous design. Overall, I am not necessarily unhappy with the lighter, but I just feel as if I was lied to about it being brand new. If you don't mind a good refurbished zippo, then go for it. If you are looking for a brand spanking new zippo(as I was), then order one elsewhere.

author.name: ByThomas S

reviews.title: Looks cool, but the fluid dries out in just 3-4 ...
reviews.body:
Zippo, american made, lifetime warranty. Windproof...check, refillable...check, durable....check. In fact, if you wear jeans, you probably have a "zippo pocket". The small pocket located inside the top of your right front pocket !

I am very pleased with this lighter. I have been carrying it every day since getting it. Zero problems, zero complaints. Construction and build quality are very good.

Thank you zippo for making a very good product !

reviews.title: Love It!
reviews.body: The brushed finish was a little rough and seemed to snag, so I wasn't entirely delighted with this lighter at first. I tried some 3000 grit automotive sandpaper3M 03064 Trizact 3-2/3" x 9" 3000 Grit Performance Sandpaper on it and it worked. Lighter still has brushed finish but no longer feels rough. Lighter works well and feels solid. It reminds me of a Zippo I carried years and years ago.

reviews.title: Fluid evaporates rapidly, so it never lights when I want it too.
reviews.body: Bought a slim because I thought they looked interesting and wanted one for my collection. Functions well and doesn't feel like much in your pocket. That being said, I wouldn't buy another one. The flame is smaller than a regular zippo, which is one of the reasons I like zippos (the fat flame). Also it doesn't quite have a zippo pa-ting when opening, it is more like a baby pa-ting and it isn't as satisfying. Good lighter, proud to own it, but I prefer normal style.

reviews.title: Try very fine grit sandpaper if you don't like the feel.  Works great.
reviews.body: Got this in the mail today along with 4oz of Zippo fluid and 3 packs each of flints and wicks. The lighter has a wick and flint in it already but has no fluid for obvious reasons. It's already got that "used" look to it (which I enjoy) so there is no harm in throwing it around in your pocket with change and whatnot. It lights on the first flick of the wheel almost every time and the fluid lasts a long time. DO NOT OVER FILL! If fluid drips out of either the top of the unit or spills out the filling end, you will have to wait for it to evaporate, otherwise when you flick your Zippo on the entire thing will burst into flames and you will most likely drop it. This has not happened to me but it is definitely possible. Remember this isn't a disposable lighter and it requires maintenance. You need to refill it, and replace the flints or wicks every so often, but it is a very nice lighter. Great for your money, and it's made in the USA like they always have been. Despite popular disbelief, this is a legit Zippo from Bradford Pennsylvania. I don't actually smoke but I love these little things. A friend of mine uses Ronsonol (yellow-bottled lighter fluid commonly found at grocery stores). Highly recommend this product.

author.name: ByDr. IN Jones

reviews.title: Functions well and doesn't feel like much in your pocket
reviews.body: I got this basic old-school Zippo lighter after being frustrated by disposables because they 1. always run out and end up in a landfill and 2. are difficult to use if you have arthritis in your thumbs.  Sometimes I couldn't work them at all, and I would get extremely frustrated!  Not with Zippo--just flip it open, lightly strike the thumb-wheel, and you have a great flame to light whatever you need to light. I've had no trouble with replacing the flints or the lighter fluid, either.  Good purchase; recommend.

reviews.title: My First Zippo
reviews.body:
Nice finish, beefy case typical zippo
Not impressed by the hinge, it is loose fitting

author.name: ByAmazon Customer

reviews.title: Great Style and Easy to Use
reviews.body:
This is a Zippo. Zippos make fire.
You have to purchase fuel separately, and I recommend purchasing some flints too when you purchase this - they're extremely cheap and nice to have around (and are available as Addon items.)

It's very comfortable in the hand. If you burn standard lighter fuel (such as that they sell separately) it has a fairly strong petroleum smell. I like the smell, some don't. It's a moot point if you are using it little, or in very large open spaces.

reviews.title: Four Stars
reviews.body: I know, it's just a lighter but come on! These things have been made the same way since the 30's, they're well built, they work and they're cool! I like the plain polished chrome myself, I just like the classic look, I don't need any logos on mine. Zippos are made right here in America and they have a lifetime guarantee. If it breaks just send it to them and they will fix it or replace it and send back to you free of charge. If you have an old one that has sentimental value and it breaks beyond repair, they'll ship it back to you along with a replacement. You just don't see that kind of service enough these days. Go with Zippo for your lighter needs and support a classic American company and it's employees working right here in the US of A! I got mine from a seller called CheapHumidors and they ship super fast. Enjoy!

author.name: ByJ Kiefer

reviews.title: A great lighter.
reviews.body:
High quality lighter. I have gone back to BICs for daily use, however, because fuel evaporates quickly from the Zippo and you have to fill it every few days.
I found a partial solution to this problem - by cutting a small section of bike inner tube and sliding over the crack when not using the lighter, I can make it last several weeks before needing to refill.

reviews.title: An American Icon
reviews.body: This is reliable and gets the job done. The only reason I didn't give it five stars is because it's a bit thin (I especially mean the case when the body is removed), and I could easily see it getting dented. Still, I can't think of any windproof lighters that are better.

author.name: ByK.Draper

reviews.title: High quality lighter. I have gone back to BICs ...
reviews.body: The less costly of the Zippo line of lighters. Noted the care & quality has started to drop off over the years. This doesn't mean the lighter won't do the job designed, but I've purchased Zippo's for over 45 years & can tell by comparing to my older lighters, the decline in workmanship is evident.

reviews.title: Love It!
reviews.body: My hubby had the same Zippo for several years and was upset when he lost it. We searched and serached but couldn't find it and he was not receptive to me traeting him to a fancy new one... He wanted HIS Zippo back!  After a week or so we simply stopped looking and he started using cheap over the counter lighters.  I decided to search on Amazon and found several to chose from, however he is a no-fuss kind of man so I purched this cheaper, similar to his old one style.... He was totally surprised and loves it! He says if it is anything like his old one, he will have it forgever.

reviews.title: Fluid evaporates rapidly, so it never lights when I want it too.
reviews.body: I got this for my husband so that he could put the butane converter into it for his cigars. This fits the conversion kit wonderfully. My husband has had no issues with this at all. He really likes it. He was a diehard zippo man Bach in the day but always hated that they always leaked in his pants pocket. Now he no longer has that worry with the butane conversion kit I also got him.

reviews.title: He likes it!
reviews.body:
It's a Zippo. Handy in lots of situations. Like many Zippos the Naphta fuel with dry out over a week or two regardless of use, flints wear out, even wicks wear out, but it's all replaceable.

Don't listen to Zippo's warnings on how using non-Zippo brand fuel would make the lighter explode. It won't. Go to a nearby large hardware store and you can buy a gallon of Naphta for the same price as a small container of Zippo brand fuel. Smells the same, burns the same. I still bought a can of Zippo fuel though, because the little squirt top is handy for refueling the lighter and not spilling.

author.name: ByBeverly

reviews.title: My husband loves this
reviews.body: It is a piece of history... This is a reliable... Time tested and rebuild-able heirloom.  Without a doubt one of the best lighters ever made.

reviews.title: Zippo on the cheap
reviews.body:
It came quick and easy along with my Black Matte One. I prefer the textured designed ones just because they don't leave fingerprints but don't be mistaken, Its Brand New and very smooth and shiny. I could've gotten a Black Ebony instead of Matte but that would leave fingerprints. I want to start a collection of non shiny/plain Zippos. Candy Apple Red, Meadow, Cerulean, and Gold Dust. These all have textured designs so they all fit in together.

I would recommend any zippo for any reason. It's a hassle always buying disposable lighters over and over and they're not even flashy.

Anyways once I received it, I did a few tricks, put in some fluid and done! All working and in one piece, Easy!

Camping, Smoking, Casual use, doesn't matter. It doesn't hurt to have one.

(Please Purchase Fluid! it does not come with fluid and DON'T COMPLAIN! And fluid is also subject to evaporation so you probably need to refill it once or twice a month depending on how much you use it.)

author.name: ByKathy S

reviews.title: Without a doubt one of the best lighters ever made
reviews.body: Love this Zippo!! I've been using it for months now for tricks. I don't use this for smoking. I am a non smoker and encourage others not to smoke. I mainly bought this so I can entertain my self when I'm bored, do tricks on it, and make bonfires. The fluid doesn't last more than a week if you use the zippo a lot, so keep an extra fluid canister near by. Thumbs UP!!

reviews.title: Excellent Product, Awesome design/texture!
reviews.body:
My Zippo looses it's lighter fluid over time requiring constant refilling. I'm not a smoker so I don't often use it. I'll stick to the more conventional lighters from the gas station for longer term storage meaning I don't have much use for this one.

Though, it looks freaken awesome.

author.name: ByTyler B

reviews.title: Love this Zippo
reviews.body:
I love the finish - that was the main reason I bought it. Apparently, I collect these now.
I bought the Armor variant so it would be sturdy and long-lasting, but the hinge has a bit of wobble to it. I've had a few other Zippo's with no hinge wobble, so win some, lose some.

reviews.title: it looks freaken awesome.
reviews.body: Gift for my brother - he loves it. Great quality lighter that looks durable and will last him a long time. Please note that it does not come with lighter fluid!

author.name: ByFreeze Dried World

reviews.title: Nice finish
reviews.body: Excellent lighter, I like it without any draw o sign, so it's perfect for me, and for that price I couldn't ask any better, I recommend this product.

reviews.title: Love It!
reviews.body: A real proper, long lasting, useful tool. Easy and satisfying to use. Had mine since last year, has a minor defect every once in a while but nothing than a few minutes and a screwdriver can't fix. Everyone I know who's complained about their zippo only had problems with it because of their own impatience. One complaint I've heard was that it wouldn't light anymore, I replaced the flint and it worked like new. Another friend lost his temper and threw it at someone on the streets of New York- But at the very least, he was impressed with the power of the impact.

reviews.title: Fluid evaporates rapidly, so it never lights when I want it too.
reviews.body:
I bought this lighter just to get a new chimney insert for my 15 year old Zippo.
Fits perfectly, and works like a Zippo should.

My old Zippo still worked, but I drilled two holes on each side to make a pipe lighter out of it and messed up.
I was left with a small piece of the chimney left the rest was gone, however, the lighter still works great even with a small piece (1/4") of the chimney intact.

I just got tired of seeing my Zippo all chewed up, so I bought this for the insert.
Very reasonably priced, and well worth the money to get my old Zippo back like it should be again.

Just goes to show that if you can put a wick and fluid into a Zippo, it will work no matter what!

reviews.title: Last lighter you'll ever buy
reviews.body:
I bought 6 of these as groomsman gifts and had them laser etched by a local trophy shop with the guy's monograms. They turned out great and paired well with the heavy duty 6 oz flasks that I got them.

I love the extra heft of these lighters, they just feel much more robust to me than the original zippos AND they're the same great quality that you expect from zippo lighters.

author.name: ByCharlie Smith

reviews.title: Zippo
reviews.body: Perfect! as described and shipped on time!

reviews.title: No Complaints, Just A Great Lighter.
reviews.body:
The classic zippo, it's more of a symbol then anything else.
You can learn to do neat tricks with it and it just looks cool.
And yes, you can light a cigarette or start a fire - no one smokes any more.
If you've never had a zippo before - it's really easy to refill it with gas and change the flint - that's the only maintenance you'll ever need to do

author.name: By1

reviews.title: Five Stars
reviews.body:
The lighter is very reliable however the first thing you need to consider is that the device itself does not come pre-fueled. This is because it's probably best you don't s*** lighter fluid. It's neat, and in the end you end up paying more for flints and lighter fluid than anything. If anything breaks zippo holds an amazing lifetime warranty. If anything on it ever breaks simply send it to zippo and they'll fix it and mail it back to you.

I've seen problems with the hinge and zippo will gladly fix that, they will also replace the wick, or anything else except for the lighter fluid for only the price of your shipping. For those complaining that it might get scratched, all zippo lighters will get scratched if you put it in your pocket with keys and other objects. It's much the the coating on your phone. The purpose in the "Street Chrome" is that it looks cool and scratches aren't noticeable. Even if the scratches became too obvious, or you got a dent it two, mail it to zippo and it will be repaired.

It's a premium product, but don't expect it to work right out of the box. It's a great lighter once you understand how to care for it and keep it in full working condition.

If you were to get any Bic lighter or hand held lighter, you can hold it upside down (you can't do that with a zippo), but it doesn't last nearly as long and it isn't as much of a fashion statement.

reviews.title: You can learn to do neat tricks with it and it just looks cool. And yes
reviews.body: I'm retired from the military (Navy) and have traveled overseas quite often during my tour. One of the things that people would invariably ask you for (once they realized you're an American) would be a zippo lighter. They are very popular in Europe (the black market) and far more valuable there than here. I'm not even a smoker, but I've always wanted one; you can't deny their utility, and in the event of an economic collapse, could be a really valuable trade commodity. There's just something about the plain ol' brushed chrome zippo lighter....

author.name: ByRobert M.

reviews.title: Cool, Reliable, Zippo
reviews.body: Zippo is by far one of the best companies out there, not only do they stand by their product, but they also have superior customer service and support American jobs. I wish more companies were as invested as Zippo. Thank you Zippo for quality lighters that I can depend on.

reviews.title: an icon...
reviews.body: Just a few things, First, it's a lighter, it does its job perfectly. Second, it can be used as a signaling device. It is definitely thicker than most standard zippos that I have had. It, for me, is an every day carry. If you are worried about smudges and fingerprints, this is a magnet for them. This is a tool, it will be dented, scratched, soiled by smudges, fingerprints and the lot. I should know , I am a tool :) and I have the scares to prove it. But I still work. And so does this lighter. Any Questions ?

author.name: ByWhite Nigma

reviews.title: Zippo is by far one of the best companies out there
reviews.body: Good for the price but it dries out and needs to be refilled frequently. If you use it regularly, it would be good, but if you use it just to light birthday candles on occasion, a cheap disposable would be a better alternative as those don't dry out.

reviews.title: Love It!
reviews.body:
From a novice user: I first bought this lighter to solve the problem of having to buy more disposables. To anyone who is thinking about making the switch, it's totally worth it. The only warning I have is that you must buy the correct kind of fluid (get zippo brand lighter fluid) or you could render your lighter almost impossible to light.

No matter what lighter you have, you'll always have to refill it. Butane lighters must receive more butane, and bics must be replaced entirely. Zippos take lighter fluid along with new wicks and flints every now and then. Each have their plus sides, except that Zippos are MUCH classier than other lighters, as well as customizable.

Message to the newbies: If end up buying one, just get everything you need. Buy Some zippo fluid, some wicks, and some flints. You may have to experiment a little and fiddle around until you figure out how to best use and maintain a zippo, but it's a nice piece of history anyone will like. And yes, you can use it for "other" things besides tobacco.

reviews.title: Fluid evaporates rapidly, so it never lights when I want it too.
reviews.body: For this price, its a great bargain! Have been using it for a month and it has been awesome. Well worth it over those cheap disposable ones because you will look cool. The only downside is that the fuel runs out pretty quickly :?

reviews.title: Looking to replace your bics?
reviews.body:
5 stars for two reasons-

1) It's a Zippo. They're amazing.
2) See reason #1.

This lighter is the STREET CHROME model. It looks like it's old, scratched, and worn. Although it doesn't have any dings or deep scratches on it, it DOES look like it's spent an eternity in a pocket of a pair of jeans, jangling around with keys and change.
If you're looking for a lighter in absolutely pristine condition with a mirror finish, this isn't the one for you.

Also, the majority of the negative reviews are coming from people that are strangely dumbfounded that it doesn't come with fluid in it. I've owned a few Zippos through my life, and NONE of them have EVER come straight out of the box with fluid in them. If one were to buy a Zippo at a fine Tobacconist, the Proprietor of said establishment may fill it for you the first time, but after that, you're on your own. These lighters ARE NOT airtight. The fuel evaporates after a while, in as little as a week. If you're looking for a lighter that you can toss in a drawer, or glove box of a car and use once a month without having to fill it, don't get a Zippo. If you're looking for a lighter that you can leave in your bug-out bag or something, don't get a Zippo. If you're looking for a lighter that won't run out of fuel while you're camping for a month, don't get a Zippo. If you have an affinity for camping with fancy-looking lighters, get a Colibri or something. Heck, some Colibris even have built-in cigar cutters. Or, better yet, get a Bic and stop trying to look so damn fancy while lighting campfires.

And Remember, if your Zippo lighter ever breaks- don't hesitate to contact Zippo, because......
"Any Zippo pocket lighter, when returned to our factory, will be put in first class mechanical condition free of charge, for we have yet to charge a cent for the repair of a Zippo pocket lighter, regardless of age or condition. The finish, however, is not guaranteed."

In case anyone needs help filling a Zippo, I've put together a handy-dandy YouTube video to show you how. http://youtu.be/noJ5amTTMUI

author.name: ByAdam SKiffington

reviews.title: Great budget zippo
reviews.body: Listed as new, clearly used and placed back in original packaging (shoddily). Did not open until months later as it was a gift for a friend. Incredibly disappointed as the window for return has closed. Would give 0 stars if possible.

reviews.title: Didn't buy from Amazon, but wanted to add my input.
reviews.body: This is my second purchase of this lighter and it works just like every other zippo, inexpensive and reliable. The only warning I would give people is they silver plate is very thin and wears off at the corners eventually exposing brass. Personally I didn't mind this as I thought it gave the lighter character, but some people may be expecting more. The antique finish keeps it from showing other wear as quickly as a shinier lighter might.

author.name: ByJ. Yu

reviews.title: Product Used and Not as Advertized
reviews.body: It's a Zippo!  You get the lighter you've likely seen your entire life.  No surprises.  However I smoke cigars, and it takes quite a bit of fuel to light a cigar. The wind resistance is much better than a disposable lighter, but is not quite as effective as a torch lighter for cigars.  But the fuel is cheap, and similarly priced torch lighters are not very reliable.  The Zippo is 100% dependable.

reviews.title: What you expect from a zippo, but does wear down eventually
reviews.body: It's a Zippo, what else do you need to say.  I works, it always works no matter what conditions I am in.  I got this Zippo to replace the one I had for the last 15 years.  The only reason that one failed was the hinge and it was easier to buy this one than to have the old one fixed.

author.name: ByAdam Brown

reviews.title: It's a Zippo!
reviews.body: Finally, I have a Zippo lighter in my possession. It is a small trophy of my Americanism and general badassery. The sound and feel of this is every bit as satisfying as the movies have told us it would be. Zippo lighters may be the single best reason to pick up smoking.

reviews.title: It's a Zippo, what else do you need to say?
reviews.body:
Zippos are iconic because they work great & haven't changed at all over the decades they've been in service. They're all easy-to-use, dependable, durable, & have that classic attractive design which not only looks brilliant, but is a sheer pleasure to hold in your hand & play with.

These heavier "Armor" versions of the standard design are even better as they are tougher and have an even more solid feel to them when you "snick" them open/closed. The sheetmetal is about twice as thick, making them even more rugged than their amply-tough predecessors.

And the heavier/sturdier build quality really doesn't make them any less-affordable. Remember how much money you'll save in the long-term by not having to buy disposable cheapo unreliable plastic lighters...

I prefer the polished chrome finish, as it's pretty & seems to be the best @ resisting scratches. I've had my Armor Zippo a couple of years now, with daily use & storage in pockets with other hard/sharp objects, and it has only minor surface scratches. I tell ya, these things are TOUGH & worth every penny.

author.name: ByDana

reviews.title: The Very Best Lighter Ever
reviews.body: Lighter comes in a small package in a box. You open the box and there is your zippo. All you need to do is refill the lighter with zippo fluid and your all good to go. It's good enough that it works

reviews.title: Love It!
reviews.body: I've wanted a Zippo for years and for whatever reason just never got around to getting one. Being a WWII junkie (I've also ordered the 1941 black crackle replica) and a fan of old movies, the Zippo is a classic and a classy look. The feel is great, the Zippo "click" stands out and the street chrome finish is a very nice look. And due to the fact that I continuously drop my Zippo attempting "tricks", it hides the scratches.  :)

reviews.title: Fluid evaporates rapidly, so it never lights when I want it too.
reviews.body: The lighter itself is the same as any other zippo but mine came with blue chalk like gunk on the inside that made it near impossible to get the insert out. I understand Brass tarnishes and all but I don't think it tarnishes like that. It is from J-15.

reviews.title: Classic look Zippo
reviews.body:
Not much can be said that hasn't already about ZIppo lighters. I've had this particular model for about a year now and it still functions like the day I got it and will probably still function many years after I'm gone. The mirror polish on it is incredibly nice and even after a year of constantly flicking it open using it, it still looks good. It has some small scratches here and there, but that just adds character.

If you're in the market for a high quality lighter this is your best bet.

author.name: ByDC

reviews.title: Ok but inside has a mess.
reviews.body: This is a great lighter- it's a Zippo, so it always works!  The finish is very distinctive, and makes it easier to hide the scratches and marks that invariably end up on a chrome lighter.  Very high quality, as always, from Zippo!

reviews.title: High quality lighter
reviews.body: The classic plain Jane Zippo windproof lighter has been a staple item since WW2. This version, changed very little from the original design by Raymond Loewy, functions perfectly and has all the groovy sound effects pre-installed.

author.name: ByJoseph B

reviews.title: This is a great lighter- it's a Zippo
reviews.body: Very smooth operation with that satisfying zippo sound upon opening works like a charm

reviews.title: An American Classic
reviews.body: It's a great size if you keep other stuff in your pockets. I don't smoke, so I usually don't use it a lot. When I do sit and play with it a lot, it does run out of fluid quicker than the big ones. The quality is good.

author.name: ByJohn S.

reviews.title: Zippo quality
reviews.body: Zippos are a nice commodity but they can't hold fuel for more than a week and it's honestly the most disappointing thing about this brand. I love the look and the sounds and the actions of zippo lighters but its just more practical to buy any other disposable lighter.

reviews.title: It's a great size.
reviews.body: Arrived on time, functions as described. Zippo windproof lighters remain the standard against which all others are judged. I bought these to hand out as gifts, since I've always relied on my Zippo. The quality remains high, the mechanics are the same as always. While other, more expensive lighters are certainly better for particular purposes, this remains my standby. These particular high-polish chrome casings look as pictured and have resisted scratching so far from light use.

author.name: ByJerry C. Diaz

reviews.title: Zippo needs to step it up
reviews.body: I don't even smoke and I bought this. Why? Pure nostalgia. My dad carried an identical lighter when I was young, 50 years ago. He even carried it even after he stopped smoking. Of course, I was fascinated by it. I can play with it now without anyone worrying I'll burn the house down. Still exactly the same. Worth buying just to support an American production worker.

reviews.title: Love It!
reviews.body: Looks great! Works well! If I'm just playing with it without fuel the base slides out a bit, but nothing that causes an issue. I love the well worn scratches. It isn't a specific pattern so it looks like a well loved old lighter. It's a silver tone but the scratches make is a little darker seeming, which I like. It isn't bright and gleaming. It came with a flint and wick but no fuel, which was fine. I found replacement wicks and flints at rite aid for cheap and cheap fuel at Wally world.

reviews.title: Fluid evaporates rapidly, so it never lights when I want it too.
reviews.body:
I've been using Zippos for years and there's nothing exactly like the sound of a plain old Zippo in your pocket jangling against keys or change. This one also didn't disappoint. It reminds me of my dad when I was a child. He had a plain old silver/gray one that he'd gotten while in the Navy during the Korean war and used for about 60 years . I was hoping mine would be the same dull sheen as his but alas it's got to get beaten up for years to get that same look I suppose. I've usually used ones with Seahawks emblems on them so I tried to protect them from losing that polished aluminum sheen and color. I got this one so I could stop babying my lighters or fearing loss/theft of an expensive lighter.
I use Zippos for everything from lighting cigarettes to campfires and my charcoal heater as well as burning stray threads on clothing. Whatever I need to light it works for its intended purpose without fail, no matter the weather conditions as well.
Being a long time user I'm already aware that you've got to fill them pretty regularly but, just like throw away butane lighters, they do warn you a dozen or so lights before they run out by taking multiple attempts to get a flame. I've got a special place on a top shelf in the laundry room for my fluid, flints and wicks but in all the years I've been using them I've never needed to change a wick. A 4oz bottle of fluid costs about as much as a 3 pack of Bics and lasts about a year.
Something different between Zippos and disposables is for whatever reason the Zippos don't seem to fall out of my pocket or some other way disposable lighters always manage to do to disappear for long periods of time.
If you want a lighter that is cost efficient over the long haul, will take a beating for decades without failing (if it does fail Zippo will fix it for free forever) , is dependable, is still made in the U.S. and can become a legacy piece handed down (my older brother got my dads when he died) that has a distinctive sound when opened or in your pocket, you can't beat a Zippo. If you're looking for one to take out only a few times a year, or less, and have it light with no filling or other work this is not what you want. For that a Bic will last for years and be trouble free, unlike ultra cheaply priced disposables.

reviews.title: Great lighter for a great price
reviews.body: Lighter arrived very fast. The mirror finish was beautiful and smooth and it was perfect for laser engraving for my groomsmen gift. All the guys loved it. Nothing beats a classic zippo. Only minor problem is that it's a fingerprint magnet and gets micro scratches easily.

author.name: BymOde fan

reviews.title: Nothing Like the Sound of a Zippo
reviews.body: never had a zippo lighter, always used disposable bics, but have always wanted one. saw one for a great price and went for it. its a really great deal. had always dreaded maintaining a lighter but i really dont mind doing it. this had kind of a nostalgic x factor for me. its easy to keep fueled and kept up and seems really durable. love that its made in america.

reviews.title: Perfect groomsman gift for laser engraving
reviews.body: received as represented and on time. looks like the genuine article

author.name: ByStephen Elmore

reviews.title: an american classic
reviews.body: My favorite Zippo so far. This zippo does not come filled with fluid, so make sure to order some with the lighter. The scroll work is laser etched, making a consistent pattern. It is very rough due to etching, though. This can be taken down with some VERY fine sandpaper. 2000+ grit, or a Dremel tool with a very fine rouge.

reviews.title: looks like the genuine
reviews.body: Zippo makes a great product (STILL!)!  What more needs to be said, except that I can't believe I was able to get one so inexpensively, as they are a very quality made product.

author.name: ByKENNY MUY

reviews.title: Cool Zippo
reviews.body: I don't smoke. I just like playing with fire.  And this lighter is great fire to play with. The smell of lighter fluid is awesome. You feel just a little bit more manly refilling your zippo each week and changing the flints.  It's an old timey feel. I'm getting each of my kids one for their birthday.

reviews.title: Very nice for the price!
reviews.body:
Going out and buying lighters can really be a pain, and honestly Bic lighters are fairly cheap. It's discusting how much money you could spend a year on disposable lighters.

For only $10, this Zippo is a great investment! Got mine, peeled the safety sticker off, filled it, moved the wick to the center, flick click light. Now I have a lighter than can literally last me the rest of my life, though I'm sure I'll be buying different ones and starting a collection.

I have heard some people complain about the smell. You're burning high quality lighter fluid, it's going to smell a little bit. This stuff is somewhat equivalent to what you would use to light charcoal. However, I only noticed the smell really on my first light. After that, smelled like any other lighter.

author.name: Byryan s

reviews.title: I just like playing with fire
reviews.body: Want a simple, Zombie Apocalypse Certified, Stainless Steel, heavy duty lighter that has been tested generation after generation with true success. Then buy a Zippo. These things last a lifetime and for 14 something bucks it's a bargain. Plus your friends will envy it's way cool look.  Far better than those lame looking 99 cents Bic lighters.  Get a Zippo!

reviews.title: Love It!
reviews.body: This is the worst Zippo brand lighter I have ever purchased. It is very poorly made and the screw that keeps the lid attached is so loose it doesnt stay closed

reviews.title: Fluid evaporates rapidly, so it never lights when I want it too.
reviews.body: So I had a zippo that I've had since 2006, but the insert just wouldn't work anymore. New flints, new wick, it was just too old. So looking for just the insert on Amazon, I discovered that it would be like $5 cheaper to buy the cheapest zippo and cannibalize it. So I swapped out their guts and got my old lighter back. Anyway, a couple days later I lost my decade old zippo and the whole venture was completely meaningless. I just want the Internet to know my story...

reviews.title: HORRIBLE
reviews.body: Classic Zippo lighter, you can't go wrong with that. Excellent build quality and the high polish model will only look better with time, with the fine surface scratches building the character of the lighter.

author.name: ByBryan

reviews.title: I only needed the guts
reviews.body: This Zippo lighter is real deal and works and holds up like any other Zippo Lighter. All you need to get is some lighter fluid and i would also suggest buying the pack of 18 flints and 3 wicks in the same shipment unless you have some already. You will be set for a while with those. This is not a cheaply made zippo it should hold up under normal use, you really have to try to break it in order to damage it. It meets all of my needs for what i use it for and has a much bigger flame than regular disposable lighters.

reviews.title: Can't go wrong with a Zippo!
reviews.body: Your typical Zippo Lighter. If you ever own one, this is just like what you see. I have a brushed finish, giving it a hardened and used look. The lighter does not come with lighter fluid since it is a hazard. Overall excellent lighter to have, you can use it do whatever lighter need. It burns as efficiently as usual.

author.name: ByJulesville

reviews.title: Excellent Lighter
reviews.body: Works great. Always wanted one of these. Looked around for a while, but never found a better price. Works great, at least until you lose it. Which I already did. Guess I will be ordering another one.

reviews.title: Your typical Zippo Lighter.
reviews.body: Doesn't retain fuel very long while not in use. Lights very consistently if you remember to fuel it every month regardless of use. I thought I'd use it as a campfire starter, but it's just too much of a hassle to keep filled. I keep it in a plastic bag with a cheap bic lighter and the bic is more convenient and thus sees more use.

author.name: BySomeGuyWhoBuysStuff

reviews.title: Works great. Always wanted one of these
reviews.body:
I dont smoke. never have and never will, but the zippo ive found still comes in remarkably handy for other things. If i need to crimp heat-shrink tubing while doing electrical work, its right there. fuel is inexpensive albeit has to be replaced every couple of weeks if you arent using the lighter as it does evaporate.

replacement parts and free repair make this an awesome lighter.

reviews.title: Shiny, but not for intermittent/emergency use.
reviews.body: Solid zippo works great quality is good price is cheap what more could you want it does not have any fluid in it obviously and i suggest you buy extra flint if your going to use it a lot say if your a smoker camper etc. its windproof to an extent like if you blow on it hard enough it will go out but if you use it outdoors when it is windy you should be fine. Also if someone is going to use this for say lighting a tobacco pipe you cant really turn this upside down because the flame goes weird so i suggest you change the insert or get a different lighter. It does work but just takes some getting used to also it does get hot where the flame is near or touches so just be warned..

author.name: ByJonathan

reviews.title: excellent american made lighter.
reviews.body: Cheapest Zippo I could find.  It looks really cool and works like any other Zippo.  I just wish they would hold the fluid and not evaporate, but that's the way they're designed, nothing against this one.  I got it because it looked closest to the ones I saw on the Band of Brothers TV series.  You will be very happy with it.  Sometimes simple is best.

reviews.title: Love It!
reviews.body: There is nothing wrong with it its a nice entry level zippo. Only thing I don't like is it dries in about a week

reviews.title: Fluid evaporates rapidly, so it never lights when I want it too.
reviews.body: It's a Zippo light, of course the quality is amazing. Nothing else to say. I installed a butane insert on mine to light my VapCap and it works like a charm.

reviews.title: There is nothing wrong with it its a nice entry level zippo
reviews.body: Is an amazing and thick Zippo lighter for the price. I bought it and is my first Zippo Lighter so I wasn't expecting much about it until it arrived. When I took it out the little box it came in I was amazed for the craftmanship, the weight, the Brushed Chrome style. And the best thing is that it Windproof! so you need to close the cap to shut out the flame. And another quality I didn't know is that all Zippos have a lifetime warranty! so if it has a defect I just send it back to the store and they either replace the damaged parts or send me a new one. I don't smoke, I bought it for collection and for light up my candles and incense. If a perfect gift and buy. Would recommend to anyone and would definetly buy another one soon again.

author.name: Byryan licciardello

reviews.title: It's a Zippo alright...
reviews.body: It looks good and makes fire after filled with fuel!

reviews.title: Brushed Chrome Lighter by Zippo
reviews.body: Not as good as older zippos

author.name: Byhungryman

reviews.title: Great lighter!
reviews.body: This is the newer "heavy-duty" version by Zippo.  The case is rugged enough to withstand the sort of abuses it gets in my pocket during work.

reviews.title: Four Stars
reviews.body:
I bought this so I could have a simple, unobtrusive and inexpensive lighter to carry around day-to-day. I have a tendency to misplace lighters, so I couldn't rightfully spend an arm and a leg on something I may very well lose, and this price certainly was right.

I haven't lost it yet *fingers-crossed*, and it is performing as well as I have come to expect from a Zippo.

author.name: ByYolymar

reviews.title: This is the newer "heavy-duty" version by Zippo. The ...
reviews.body: very nice item.. Nothing else to say. buy it , you will like it!. Its brushed chrome so its not as smooth as you will expect it to be but its good, it kinda slips more than a chrome finish would when your hands are sweaty.

reviews.title: A plain, no-frills zippo lighter
reviews.body: Good lighter, it's a zippo, no more to say.

reviews.title: Love It!
reviews.body: Its a simple zippo... Most common use of this is burning down the gasoline you spill to your enemy gang's depot near ocean. But its cool to use it as a cigarette lighter too. You should also consider high polised version as I had to polish this one because it was as it says BRUSHED...

reviews.title: Fluid evaporates rapidly, so it never lights when I want it too.

This is my very first Zippo.

Awesome! love the feel of it.
been going through some YouTube vids to learn some Zippo tricks. Not sure if it's suppose to be like this, but the Zippo is a bit slippery.
But I'm sure I'll get use to it in no time.

reviews.title: You Should Consider High Polish One
reviews.body:
Zippo quality. Apparently, this is the kind of lighter that can leak, but I haven't had any problems with that yet.
Make sure to buy some fuel to go along with it!

author.name: ByOnur K.

reviews.title: QUALITY all around
reviews.body: Its a Zippo, with love and care it'll outlast you, and your children, possibly not your children's children, I feel like tobacco use will have seriously declined in two generations. But who cares, they'll be able to light a fire in a hurricane if they want.

reviews.title: Zippo quality. Apparently, this is the kind of ...
reviews.body: Hard to prime the wick - took a lot of work to get it to light on the first try.  Is OK now, but you'll need to put a significant amount of char (carbon) on the wick for it to be 100% - char the wick with another flame BEFORE you fill the lighter with fluid.

author.name: ByJovan Roetz

reviews.title: with love and care it'll outlast you
reviews.body: This Zippo lighter is one of the best tools ever made. You do not have to be a smoker to get some good use out of one of these things. I use them to ignite anything that needs to be set on fire, a torch, a pile of brush, etc. I mean, these things were passed out to soldiers entering World War 2 as a tool of war.

reviews.title: Needs Work to light 100%
reviews.body: I'm new to zippo and do not smoke so I rarely use the lighter. I keep it for emergencies however the fuel seems to dissipate and not be there when I need it. I will be switching to butane. If you smoke which I recommend you do not smoke this might be okay

author.name: ByMiles B Huff

reviews.title: Best tool ever made
reviews.body: These aren't built as well as they once were. I filled this with the appropriate amount of lighter fluid, but I soon noticed that once I ignited the wick, the sides were soon emitting a flame as well. I slammed the lighter shut and it extinguished without incident (luckily), but I would have expected more from a Zippo. I'd probably get a higher end model.

reviews.title: Not my ideal lighter
reviews.body: I use mine so often that I need to refill it every other day. Tedious! Also, I don't know how much lighter fluid to put in. Most of the time, it overflows everytime I put the lighter back together making a real dangerous mess.

author.name: ByCody

reviews.title: ok, but with some caveats
reviews.body: I was looking forward to getting this as I have gone through more than my share of the butane lighters and they seem to always die on me just when I am getting ready to light a cigar.  Not this one though.  Lights every time and flame has been reliable outdoors. If you leave it running too long, it can get quite hot, so be sure to close the lid as soon as you can.

reviews.title: Love It!
reviews.body: Works just like my old one that I lost years ago. Plus it's made here in the USA

reviews.title: Fluid evaporates rapidly, so it never lights when I want it too.
reviews.body: Got this for my brother in-law as a present,I don't smoke, but I have some zippo collection,this is a valuable piece,with the presence of electronic cigarettes, disposable lighters,thousands of brands and profits,Zippo is still on top of its game,still manufactured same as a century ago or so, this lighter is very dependable,and thousands of designs you can choose,and yet its prices are so affordable.

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.body: I bought this in a fit of nostalgia. Though I haven't smoked in over 30 years, there are still occasions when it's nice to have a source of flame handy. Over the years, I've used a lot of disposable, plastic lighters, and there are benefits to them, but I grew tired of stuffing my eco-conscience every time I tossed a used-up Bic into the trash. When this Zippo arrived, it was like meeting an old friend after many years apart.

author.name: ByMarvin R

reviews.title: Zippo Chrome..
reviews.body: Cheap, cheap, cheap. This is not your father's Zippo. I was expecting the heafty chromed lighter of yore. This is a toy. I have no idea why I didn't return it.  Maybe because they didn't advertise it to be what I expected and therefore it was my fault for thinking that some things are still made like they used to be made.  Not this thing.

reviews.title: Still a great lighter
reviews.body:
Grerat lighter, fairly durable in wind and the best part is the flipping of the case. Oh yes.

Pros: Great look
Sick flip top
Trust worthy flame life
What everyone at a point wanted in life. lol
Can buy lighter fluid for it that lasts soooo long

Cons: The lighter fluid gets dried up kindof quick if you dont use it for awhile. But this is solvable if you have the Zippo Lighter Fluid.

Need to replace the flint every couple of weeks if using lighter regulary but their very cheap!

author.name: ByRealTnT

reviews.title: Just a toy.
reviews.body: I love this thing. It is easy to fill and maintain. It is windproof unless you blow from top. One flaw is if you use it for a while the flint gets too hot to touch then you cant light it again. But its nice to carry around.

reviews.title: Honest Review of this Zippo Lighter
reviews.body: Being in my 60s, I remember  my mom and dad using their zippo,s. If memory serves me right, then zippo of that day were larger,a little  sturdier. But it still a zippo, well engineered for a lighter.still not a bad use of 15 dollars.

author.name: ByWilliam M

reviews.title: Zippo Classic
reviews.body: This lighter is just awesome. It is very wind resistant, and it holds fluid well. I lit the lighter and held it in front of a fan that was on full blast and the flame still did not go out. I have no complaints! But a word of advice: please use your brain when purchasing this product. You have to fill the lighter with fluid yourself, it does not come with fluid because that would be unsafe and I'm pretty sure it's illegal as well.

reviews.title: solid,not great
reviews.body: What can I say Zippo lighters are still as Dependable now as they were when they first started in the business.

author.name: BySB

reviews.title: Zippo lighter
reviews.body: I'm not much of a smoker, I like a good cigar every now and again, although, I mostly purchased this simply because, its good to have around especially in an emergency situation. Its an awesome lighter though for the intended purpose as well, I've lit several cigars with it and have got a great even burn, which is no easy accomplishment with a lot of lighters like Bics. Its finish holds up AMAZINGLY as well. I usually keep it in the pocket with my keys and there are no deep scratches what so ever. There are only some small ones visible when viewed VERY close up.

reviews.title: Love It!
reviews.body:
I love this shiny chrome. This way it'll show wear and patina overtime which I like.

I am currently using this with a Vector Thunderbird insert and it works great. Also don't have to worry about fuel evaporation and butane burns much cleaner.

reviews.title: Fluid evaporates rapidly, so it never lights when I want it too.
reviews.body:
Though outdoorsmen do well to be familiar with a variety of fire-starting methods, lighters are - and are likely to stay - the most popular fire-starting choice. And since the butane (BIC style) lighters are most readily available, they are the most often used.

THE CLASSIC ZIPPO, THOUGH, IS ACTUALLY MUCH BETTER FOR AN OUTDOORSMAN THAN ANY DISPOSABLE BUTANE LIGHTER (DBL).

=> Zippos produce a much more robust flame than DBLs, which give only a very thin jet of flame.
=> Zippos do not blow out in the wind so easily as DBLs. I'd stop short of saying that Zippos are "completely" windproof but they are highly wind-resistant. DBLs aren't even a little wind resistant.
=> Unlike DBLs, a Zippo will give you a sustained flame without any danger of blistering your thumb. You can even light it, set it aside, and keep it burning like a candle if you like.
=> Unlike DBLs, a Zippo won't accidentally bleed off its fuel while fraternizing with the other stuff in your pocket or pack. (They do dry out, though. I top mine off with a couple Cubic CMs of fluid once every couple of weeks.)
=> Though I have not personally tried it, I am told that if you get caught short of fuel a Zippo will work with alternative fuels, such as kerosene. (If you intend to experiment with this, exercise caution!)
=> Last but not least is the Zippo lifetime warranty. If a Zippo fails to work, just go on their website for instructions on returning it. They'll fix it for you free and even pay the return postage for you.

Tip: The lighter fluid (naptha) is a skin irritant. Rather than jamming it right into your pocket when freshly refilled, it is a good idea to let it sit out for an hour so that any excess fuel can evaporate.

Update, January 2013: I have found an easy fix for the "fuel evaporation problem" I mentioned. Cut a piece of bike inner tube as a sleeve to encase these lighters once fueled. I have found that instead refueling the lighters every couple of weeks I can wait a couple of months before having to top them off. Of course this won't work for smokers who want a flame several times a day. But it works great for keeping the lighter ready for an emergency that requires fire.

reviews.title: Great for Thunderbird Insert
reviews.body:
I don't smoke (true!) at all, but buying this was really handy since friends do, and also its pretty cool to practice the many tricks out there for these little guys.

I have two other 'fancier' Zippos, but this is my everyday, go to, lighter since it has the 'roughed' up look already, and is simple enough to warrant engraving to make it look even better.

The price is also amazing. Got this guy for $7 even, and didn't look back.

author.name: ByBoris

reviews.title: Not a smoker? Great for outdoorsmen anyway!
reviews.body: Nice lighter love it

reviews.title: Great for an 'everyday' lighter.
reviews.body: Loved this lighter for the short time I'm actually able to use it. Having to refill the port with gas is such a pain. It is a lot easier just to buy a butane lighter, or use bic lighters.

author.name: BySaint Richard

reviews.title: Five Stars
reviews.body: It works.

reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend.

author.name: ByI am not Rappaport

reviews.title: It's a Zippo!
reviews.body:
It is simple and reliable. Nothing can really happen to a lighter with such a simple, years-proven design. You can easily disassemble it yourself for servicing purposes, if needed. Whatever happens, you just need some high-octane fuel to keep it working (of course, during a peacetime special zippo liquid is recommended for better performance and minimum smell :).
I personally like high polish chrome with no engraving or picture on it, as it looks most neutral and stylish to me.

As for the gas smell by the way, is not strong when the lighter is closed.
The lighter is absolutely suitable for all the situations when you would take your bic lighter previously.
It is not too big or heavy.

I like the fact that you don't need to keep any button pressed to keep fire going. This might be useful when you use the lighter as matches - you can pass it to your friend, use to start a fireplace, warm your hands or even maybe warm some food.

I have noticed that inner part goes outside for 2-3 centimeters when you open/close the lighter for a few times, however it does not go further. But I've fixed this by putting a small aluminum foil strip inside the lighter.

You have to get some practice so you won't put an excessive amount of fuel when "recharging" the lighter. I recharge mine once per 1-3 weeks.
By the way, this lighter comes with no fuel, so make sure you've purchased some zippo liquid if you want to use your lighter right away. Or consider buying a zippo all-in-one kit which includes liquid. But as far as I know, there are no kits with high polish chrome lighters.

The lighter is wind-proof and it does not afraid of some amounts of water or sand. I.e. obviously you can blow it out, but when it comes to real usage, this lighter should survive under almost any conditions.

reviews.title: Absolutely Love It!
reviews.body: Everybody should own one of these even if you don't smoke. I use mine frequently when I go camping or need a quick flame anywhere.

reviews.title: It's a zippo
reviews.body:
When I first received this lighter I was VERY pleased with how it looks. It has a scratched chrome finish, which gives it a rugged, yet classy feel. It lights very easily and can withstand even the strongest of winds. For the first two weeks, I found every excuse I could to use a lighter.

Not long after that, I found myself leaving it at home more and more. Therein lies the problem: As with all Zippos, the fluid chamber is not sealed. This results in the lighter fluid evaporating in a week or so. I would not suggest you buy this lighter unless you smoke or live in a very windy area.

reviews.title: It's a Zippo
reviews.body: I have a very large collection of Zippo Lighters,well into the high 60's, and this is the one and only Armor Zippo that I own. If I was Blindfolded and had to pick this lighter out of all my Zippo's piled together, it would be very easy. The Armor Zippo's have a very rugged and durable feel to them. All my Zippo's tend to get treated a little rough from time to time, but this Armor Zippo has held up really well. The finish has a few light scratches on it but they could easily be buffed out with no problem. Also these Armor Zippo's are great for engraving because they are so thick. In summary, if you don't own an Armor Zippo, pick one up because they are truly a great tool and they make an excellent conversation piece as well.

reviews.title: Five Stars
reviews.body:
This lighter is awesome!! I believe I paid nine dollars & forty-nine cents with free shipping... how can you go wrong? If you include the extras that I bought (flints, wick and fluid), I paid about eighteen dollars total... which is still less than the cheapest Zippo I've seen in the case at my local gas station! NOTE: This lighter comes with a wick and single flint already in place... all you need to do upon receiving it is add lighter fluid. Also, there's plenty of youtube videos out there showing you how to add fluid, change a flint, change a wick, etc. if you don't already know how.

I was going to get a chrome version of this which I found for ten bucks, but once I saw that this was lower priced, I decided to go with this one. Plus, with this Zippo, it already looks "worn in" so you don't have to worry about it getting scuffed up in your vehicle or pocket. I almost bought one of Zippo's BLU butane series lighters (because I smoke cigars too), but after some thought, I could'nt imagine someone like John Wayne lighting his smokes with a Zippo BLU butane, so that kind of sealed the deal for me... not to mention that the cheapest Zippo BLU is 3x the cost of this little beaut. After purchasing this lighter, strangely enough, all my friends who smoke want to get their own Zippo and they ask to borrow this when they light their smokes instead of using their little Bic lighters. I'm very pleased with my purchase of this Zippo from Amazon... for the price, it's hard to go wrong!

reviews.body: Really love this little gem. I wanted a compact reliable lighter to use to light my cigars when i wanted to change things up and not use my torch lighter. I had originally gotten the vintage 1931 edition for this only to find that the hinge was too bulky for it to consistently open and close properly. Thats not a problem with this one, action and very smooth and no durability seems to be lost with the smaller size. Holds a flame well and consistently, just like a normal sized zippo. Can't really complain about anything, you get what you pay for. Would buy again.

reviews.title: perfecr
reviews.body: I loved this lighter, but quit using it because I grew tired of how often I had to refill it with fluid.  I think more evaporates out than ever gets burned.  I live in the Arizona desert, so this get exposed to greater heat than yours will and our very dry air speeds the drying too.  I'd even tried to keep it in a ziplock bag to slow the fluid's evaporation, but that got awkward.   I like that itll lit during our bitterly cold 40 degree winter days when my Bic lighter wont -- It's easy to refill the lighter, BUT we must be careful to not overfill it because the wick can be too wet to light, then gives a ball of fire when it does.  Of course, it's downright embarrassing when I overfill it, I get fluid on my hand, I light it and my kids then think I'm some kind of superhero with a flaming hand.  OKAY, that didn't all happen, but I get eager for a smoke, have to wait to refill the lighter (again) then wait even longer for my hand to dry off.  I DON'T consider this dangerous if anyone has a lick of common sense.  BUT remember the reason these faded out of common use was because of how easy they are to light by toddlers and kids.  I personally inspected a burned-out home because a 3-yr-old got hold of one, lit it, dropped it when it burned his hand and the flame stayed lit. -- -- All considered, I don't use it, but keep it handy as a backup along with a can of fluid.

reviews.title: Five Stars
reviews.body:
The Zippo Armor Chrome Lighter arrived on schedule as promised. My only concern is that the flip-top lid is slightly loose and it
wobbles side to side. I suspect that the seller purchased factory imperfection Zippo lighters at a huge discount and then is reselling
them on Amazon.com. This is a minor problem since Zippo Company offers a free lifetime warranty with every Zippo lighter sold.
Outside of that minor imperfection, the lighter does perform very well as I would expect a Zippo lighter to work. I am keeping this Zippo Armor lighter safety packaged in my glove box in my automobile strictly for emergency use. When traveling throughout the USA you never know when you may become stranded someplace, and this Zippo lighter may even save my life someday by allowing me to build a fire for heat. Periodically, I will check the lighter to assure the lighter fluid has not evaporated.

reviews.title: ZIPPO
reviews.body: If you are familiar with Zippo brand lighters, this will get you one for relatively little cost. I found the construction to be decent, as I expected. The finish, alignment, and small parts are all well done. No fault to the lighter, I don't think you can avoid the little hinge being the weak point. I have not had any problems with the hinge yet, but if you dropped the lighter or it got opened and bent in your pocket or something, the hinge wouldn't stand a chance. Not too likely, but accidents happen. If you are careful with it, I imagine it will last a lifetime. Flint wheel action, flame, wick entry, and general construction seem like they will function suitably for the next few decades. Compared to a standard disposable lighter, the parts on a Zippo are built like a tank, and you don't have that much additional weight. A real benefit is that you won't be throwing out a bunch of plastic lighters anymore. Just one thing you can't do with a Zippo that you can with a disposable. I sometimes use lighters to burn bugs, mostly ticks. The Zippo will not shoot a flame like a disposable lighter will. The flame just gently burns straight up from the wick, meaning if you turn the lighter on its side, the flame goes up thru the flame guard. So I still keep one of those on hand for just such occasions. Anything else, if you need a flame, the Zippo will do the job. (I don't know if Zippo's new BLU line of butane lights might throw a flame, but could be worth looking into if you need this.)

There's just something to be said for such a beautifully simple design.  Perhaps its the engineer inside me thats drawn to Zippos.  The lighter I recieved was manufactured in February of 2012 yet the insert was from september of 1996.  A tad bit odd, but it works fine anyways.  All my previous lighters had inserts that were manufactured at the same time as the case, plus or minus a month or two.  Has anyone else come across such a drastic difference in manufacture dates?

reviews.title: Five Stars
reviews.body: Great lighter for the price.  The street chrome lighter has a "scratched" appearance to it (which is what I was looking for).  It gives it a used, "weathered" appearance, but still looks nice.  I am a pack a day smoker and have always used Bic lighters, but decided to give a Zippo a try.  Aside from the fact that I have to refill the lighter about once a week, I have thoroughly enjoyed it!  I love the classic Zippo click sound when you open and close it.  One thing I discovered that is a plus, is that the wick is actually a couple of inches long, so when you need "new" wick, all you have to do is take a pair of needle nose pliers and pull the wick up to the desired height, and then trim it.  I have been using this everyday for almost a month, and have not have to pull more wick through or had to replace the flint yet.  One safety note: for anyone who has never used a Zippo before - when you light it - it stays lit until you close the lid or the flame gets blown out.  If you light it and drop it on the floor by accident like I did, there is a good chance it will stay lit.  For the price, and quality - I would recommend!

I don't do it as often anymore, but it still helps me refrain. Also, it works great when I need a lighter for other reasons than smoking. reviews.title: Fluid evaporates rapidly, so it never lights when I want it too.
reviews.body:
Zippo's are timeless. This lighter works great and is extremely reliable provided that you use it regularly! The reason I deducted 1 star from my review is because I find that if this lighter is left to sit for a while, the lighter fluid quickly evaporates and renders the lighter useless.... This pitfall is probably not of much concern to the individual who will be using this as their everyday lighter for smoking. However, I actually don't smoke and instead, use this lighter for when I go on hiking trips and camping trips. For this purpose I don't believe the zippo excels at all. I would really rather carry either a box of matches or a Bic lighter for this purpose for fear of the lighter fluid drying up in the zippo right when I may need it most!
I think any good lighter should be able to retain it's fuel for an indefinite amount of time.

reviews.title: Upgrade of Zippo's most popular model.

author.name: ByRazzSpew10

reviews.title: Classic Zippo quality
reviews.body:
I first started getting into wanting a Zippo after finding my dad's old brass deal, and I noticed it smudged a lot and never kept a shine. So when I got around to buying my own, I bought the 1941 replica, then the 1937, and because I wanted one of each main type of lighter that they sold in silver, I needed to get a standard windproof, and having bought my friend a chrome high polish Zippo, I liked it, but knew it was going to get used and abused, so I didn't want something that was only going to get scratches in it.

Enter the brushed chrome. This isn't a 'cheap' Zippo by any quality standard, the chrome finish gives it balls. No muss or fuss with this thing, works fine, solid closing and opening, no play. Flint wheel works, everything is exactly how a Zippo should be, and best of all, the finish makes it look like the thing can take a bullet and still hold up, it just looks tough. It may be one of the cheaper lighters Zippo offers, because it is a basic.But I don't like graphics, I like it plain and simple. I hold it right up there with my replicas and I'm totally satisfied with my purchase.

author.name: ByAmazon Customer

reviews.title: Very dependable
reviews.body:
So I wanted to buy myself a Zippo and I didn't want one of the colorful or more ostentatious ones. I found this one for $11 (might've been on sale? I dunno, that's the price listed at the time of this review) and figured why not? All Zippos are the same and this one has that plain flavor I was looking for.

Pros
1. The finish is good. You can easily tell from the picture that it's pre-scratched chrome and that is exactly what I got. Looks worn which is nice. I never liked brand-new-looking Zippos because they're too shiny. This one is minimal and it looks nice.
2. Once I filled it with fluid, it lit right away. No flint or wick issues.
3. Hinge has a good click to it.
4. Solid Zippo build quality.
5. Surprisingly inexpensive for a Zippo.

Cons
1. None so far.

Unless this thing unexpectedly dies (I'll update my review if it does), then I can't think of a reason why this wasn't a good purchase. It works well, it's minimal, and with the fluid and flints I bought, it should last me many, many years. Goodbye forever plastic lighters.

reviews.title: Five Stars
reviews.body:
I already had one of these and I am about to buy a second, due to the first one being lost.

For the person who asked: The casing is made of brass and plated with silver. The silver plating is artificially aged and then some sort of clearcoat is applied on top of it. It most certainly does look like the picture, but it also has a bit of a gloss to it when you first get it.

When I received my lighter, it came with a piece of paper stating that the finish was designed with wear in mind, and the clearcoat was intended to gradually wear off. True to its word, after a year of having it, the clearcoat has scratched and worn off a bit in some places as intended, but the silver plating is still 100%. Overall, the finish looks very tasteful and broken in-- Like an antique.

author.name: ByDan

reviews.title: great lighter
reviews.body: These zippos can't be beat!  I have used these zippo lighters for various reasons, none of which applied to smoking.  These zippo lighters are reliable, come with a lifetime warranty, and are stylish.  They have been around a long time, at least dating back to the Korean conflict, maybe WWII ?  A simple and effective design, Zippo lighters come in the fluid type (which this one is), and the butane gas type.  I ordered the Weave design because I anticipated some external abuse while carrying, and I'm glad I did.  These lighters are real affordable, and are identical to all fluid Zippos, including the collectible pricey line.  I actually practice some of the zippo tricks if I have any spare time, which is rare.  If you smoke, I'm sure these classic lighters will do the job.  Priced great, shipping was fast and this made for a super transaction!  Way to go Amazon!!!

reviews.title: Five Stars
reviews.body: Plain Jain simple, inexpensive, reliable lighter for an emergency pack I also use as a backup signaling mirror.  It'll work using all sorts of flamable solvents in an extreme situation if the recommended lighter fluid is unavailable.  Replacement parts can be found cheap all over the planet.  If I'm in a hurricane, I have lots of other things that need to get done quickly rather than stand there tring to light up a cigarette (don't smoke anyway).  And a campsite or stove is going to be sheltered anyway.  When that high tech lighter won't work or breaks, this one will just keep making fire.
