reviews.title: Love It!
reviews.body:
This is the 'Slim", 70%-Sized version of the Standard Classic ZIPPO. Proudly made in the USA.

If you're browsing this deep into the ZIPPO lighter lineup, you're already a ZIPPO fan so I don't have to sell you on the brand, or on old-school fluid lighters. Classic ZIPPO quality. A pattern virtually unchanged since the 1930s, backed by a lifetime warranty that they actually honor, no questions asked.

Photo note: the photo looks more "blue" tinted and the scratches look more pronounced in the photo than in real life. This 'Street Chrome' version is the standard High Polish Chrome (mirror) version which is then pre-scratched as if in a tumbler. It looks pretty much like any High Polish Chrome model would look after you carry it every day among keys, coins etc for a year or two. Additional pocket wear and routine scratches won't show. Solid 'click'. Feels good in the hand.

All lighters in the USA are by law shipped 'dry' (without fuel), so you'll want to buy ZIPPO or Ronsonol brand lighter fluid from any drugstore or WalMart near you. Instructions come with your ZIPPO and there are tons of useful how-to's on youTube, the ZIPPO website and on the various online Lighter Forums.

This 'Slim' model is about 70% the size of a Standard size ZIPPO--same height, but about 30% narrower.
It holds less fuel, so you'll need to refill it a little more frequently. No big deal, but good to know up front.

Lighter fluid (naptha, and not the same as "charcoal lighter fluid") gradually evaporates over a couple of weeks or so out of any lighter (even if not used) and will need refilling.
New owners are sometimes surprised to learn that they can't just drop this in a drawer for 6 months like any disposable Bic lighter. So a Zippo is not what you want to leave inside your long term emergency evacuation bag --the Bics are a better choice for any standby kit. You CAN reduce evaporation about 50% by storing the ZIPPO in a ziplock freezer bag.

This is a great, useful fun retro item and a beautiful piece of Americana to own. Also check out the Street Chrome, Black Crinkle, Camo, Olive Green Matte and 1941 Replica models.

At $11 delivered this is less than half what you would pay at a smoke shop or retail outlet. Price is a steal.

Classic ZIPPO, fire in your hand, what's not to love?

Hope this is helpful. Happy 'clicking', everybody.

reviews.title: Fluid evaporates rapidly, so it never lights when I want it too.
reviews.body: These zippos were made to last and I can see how durable they are, they need to refill a lot because they dry up quick (probably last about 3 weeks for me, but can vary) and their fuel is expensive, but I think its worth it as the lighter is very nice. I recommend any buyers to use their fuel as they do last longer than other fuel types, and if you use another fuel to light it, it may product a small flame or bigger flame from what others have experienced. Other than that little complain about the fuel its a nice addition if i ever need it when going out to the wilderness.

reviews.title: Classic ZIPPO, "Slim" Model in "Street Chrome" Finish-- American Fire In Your Hand!
reviews.body: After 2 month sof usage the lighter is not working, i have a warranty but i did not expect it to fail within 2 months.

author.name: ByGB

reviews.title: Nice Lighter, but fuel runs out fairly quickly.
reviews.body:
I got this as a Christmas present from my brother back in 2000 (I think). I've had it for 15 years, and I can say it's one of the better lighters I've used. It's super-simple only one moving part, no electronics, no electric igniters, no pressurized butane, and it's just about bulletproof. You can stomp it, run it over, drop it, dunk it in water, or leave it outside for weeks. It's wind-resistant and will burn just about any flammable liquid you can put in it, but I don't recommend anything other than Zippo or Ronson fuel, which is mostly naphthaline and some other hydrocarbons.

I really do love the Zippos. They've been around forever and haven't changed a bit aside from some simple updates. It's made from formed sheet brass, I'd say about 28 gauge-it's pretty thin, that's gone through an extruder. The fuel reservoir, chimney, wick, and flint wheel are housed in the insert that slides into the body. It's made from sheet steel, bent and formed. The fuel reservoir is stuffed with cotton to hold the fuel, and the wick threads up through it. It's caped off by a dense piece of cotton held in place by a spring-loaded brass screw that houses the flint holder. To fill, you lift the cotton and squirt in the fuel until the cotton is saturated. Put the insert in the lighter body, and you're good to go! The lid is spring-loaded and snaps shut to extinguish the flame and keep out dust and dirt. It's not water proof, so it's not a water-tight seal, but it still resist water and would light when wet.

To light it, flip the top and spark the wheel and that's it! Super simple. The wick is cotton with metal inserts to keep it standing up straight. It will last forever, and the only thing I had to replace was the flints, which also last a long time.

As far as durability, this is one of the most durable lighters I've ever owned. It will last forever if you take care of it. The only things that would wear out is the wick and possibly the spring mechanism that holds the lid closed. It's wind-resistant. I've got it to keep lit in pretty windy conditions. The flame is bigger than most all lighters as well, as much as a butane lighter turned all the way up or more. The fuel lasts a long time if you don't keep it lit for long periods, otherwise it won't last nearly as long as a butane lighter. It's easy to fill, and it's important not to over fill it as it will leak out of the wick and all over the place. When you light it, poof! You'll have a lighter on fire. It uses the standard "Zippo" type fuels. I recommend only Zippo brand or Ronson. You could use gasoline, paint thinner, Coleman fuel, jet fuel, or diesel in a pinch, but I don't recommend it. I love this lighter. I don't use it much anymore since I don't smoke, but it is always on standby!

Highly recommended for any survival kit, camp gear, or around the house.

reviews.title: Waste of Money
reviews.body: A classic zippo. I got it as a lighting deal so it was well worth it. I personally don't smoke, but I have always wanted a zippo so finally got one, and it was what I expected from a zippo. I wish they would include a lighter fluid as well, but sadly they do not. Most probably because zippos are not very good in holding in the fluid, so a zippo sitting around on a shelf would just evaporate into the air. Compaired to other lighters out in the market now, zippos aren't really the best choice if you're using it as an emergency/survival item because they'll dry out on you after a week. This is mostly a collectors thing now or novelty item nowadays, Although, if you really wanted tom you can buy a different piece for your zippo's cotton fluid storage compartment that is enclosed it won't run dry on you like a typical zippo. A classic zippo like this would require a lot of lighter fluid and maintenance because you have to add it every week or so. Overall if you're just looking for a cool classic lighter then this is for you. If you're on the go and traveling out a lot then I'd go for a bic or something else that does not require you to carry around lighter fluid.

author.name: ByBrian

reviews.title: Best Lighter-Ever
reviews.body:
Review of: "Zippo Chrome Lighters," by Zippo.

This lighter is classic Zippo. The manufacturer specifications include: "Metal body. Made in USA. Genuine Zippo windproof lighter with distinctive Zippo "click." All metal construction; windproof design works virtually anywhere. Refillable for a lifetime of use; for optimum performance, we recommend genuine Zippo premium lighter fluid, flints, and wicks. Made in USA; lifetime guarantee that "it works or we fix it free." Fuel: Zippo premium lighter fluid (sold separately)."

The Zippo lighter created the standard for the classic lighter. This variant is no exception. Fill with lighter fluid. Bam! Done. The Zippo lighter is the standard in the industry. Keep the flame alive! Five stars.

reviews.title: A Classic
reviews.body:
I bought this on another website. It comes warrantied "for life" which is a good sign. The Street Chrome material as most have pointed out is supposed to come scratched and used looking, but I didn't mind that too much. The inside of the case also had large peels and scratches on the metal probably characteristic of the design. It didn't come with fuel but you could buy a small 4oz can for $2 at Walmart. Simple to light after adding a few drops of the lighter fluid under the padding (it's not cotton, it's something more absorbent) but a real fuel guzzler (I've had to refill mine twice today but I was lighting it up for fun quite often).

You want to wash your hands after filling it up. Last thing you want is a spark hitting your zippo fluid soaked hands. Last thing you'd want to do is get any on yourself but wash off your hands anyways.

The one issue I've had with mine is the lid is a little offset and loose and I pinched the hinge a bit with needle nose pliers to tighten it up a bit. Other than that, it's a fine, genuine zippo. Wick's almost burned all the way through so I'm going to have to pull it up and clip off the burnt part (keep in mind there's 4 inches of wick you don't need to replace it until it's all used up. Just pull up on it to reveal the unused bits).

author.name: ByM. Jahangir Ali

reviews.title: Keep The Flame Alive!
reviews.body: it broke after about 5 months - very dissapointed

reviews.title: First Zippo
reviews.body:
Classic ZIPPO quality. Proudly made in USA. A pattern virtually unchanged since the 1930s, backed by a lifetime warranty that they actually honor, no questions asked.

The Amazon photo is a little misleading--the photo shows a 'blue'-ish matte tint and the scratches appear deeper and more pronounced in the photo than they really are. The 'Street Chrome' is actually a brightly polished mirror-chrome which has been lightly scratched in all directions, as if in a tumbler. It looks exactly like any mirror-polish chrome ZIPPO after it's been in your pocket for EDC carry along with keyring, coins etc for a couple of years. So, additional actual pocket wear and routine scratches won't show.
ZIPPO also offers a 'Satin Chrome' finish which is like a solid, evenly sandblasted flat matte in a light grey. Check that model out.
Solid 'click'. Feels good in the hand.

All lighters in the USA are by law shipped 'dry' (without fuel), so you'll want to buy ZIPPO or Ronsonol brand lighter fluid from any drugstore or WalMart near you. Instructions come with your ZIPPO and there are tons of useful how-to's on youTube, the ZIPPO website and on the various online Lighter Forums.

Lighter fluid (naptha, and not the same as "charcoal lighter fluid") gradually evaporates over a couple of weeks or so out of any lighter (even if not used) and will need refilling.
New owners are sometimes surprised to learn that they can't just drop this in a drawer for 6 months like any disposable Bic lighter. So a Zippo is not what you want to leave inside your long term emergency evacuation bag --the Bics are a better choice for any standby kit. You CAN reduce evaporation about 50% by storing the ZIPPO in a ziplock freezer bag--YMMV.

This is a great, useful fun retro item and a beautiful piece of Americana to own. Also check out the Street Chrome, Black Crinkle, Camo, Olive Green Matte and 1941 Replica models.

Prices for ZIPPOs on Amazon can fluctuate wildly, but are usually less than you would pay at a smoke shop or retail outlet.

Classic ZIPPO, fire in your hand, what's not to love?

Hope this is helpful. Happy 'clicking', everybody.

author.name: BySirStinky

reviews.title: Trash
reviews.body: really bad and overrated trash it constantly needs refueling and smells horrible just get a bic lighter for 50 cent

reviews.title: Love It!
reviews.body: My older boys are 26 and 24. This year for Christmas I am making them each a man kit. I included a Zippo Armor lighter, a Victorinox knife, a Fisher pen and a small Olight flashlight. Put it all in a Maxpedition pouch. This is the stuff I think every guy should carry with them at all times. Couldnt go wrong with a Zippo lighter. Simply the best. Especially like the Armor series. Heavy duty, great looks and that signature Zippo click. Still made in America . I love America. Highly recommend. Thanks for reading

reviews.title: Fluid evaporates rapidly, so it never lights when I want it too.
reviews.body: I ordered this lighter and got a package of buttons... I'm pissed!

reviews.title: Man stuff
reviews.body:
Pros:
+ Armor casing is 1.5x thicker than normal Zippos
+ Thicker casing is noticeably sturdier than the ones found on standard Zippos
+ Classical Zippo construction
+ Shiny (Yes, I'm a simpleton)

Cons:
- Scratches are painfully visible
- Fingerprint magnet

Warning: The hinge is liable to break if you're not careful and it's the most sensitive part of the unit. I've had the hinge on one of these break in the past but that was likely the result of years of mistreatment. They're extremely sturdy otherwise, provided you don't abuse them.

No to sound like a paid spokesperson but you really can't go wrong with a Zippo. These are lighter you can (and should!) become attached to. They require little maintenance and will last obscene amounts of time with a little care.

Side note: Zippo has an amazing warranty on their lighters; they will fix any Zippos you send in for free (seriously!). The mailing address and instructions are available on the Zippo website. Just be ready to wait a few weeks for them to send it back. They do an excellent job of repairing the cases and will replace the lighter insert (the unit inside the casing) when you send it in.

author.name: ByMoose

reviews.title: Wrong item
reviews.body: I was incredibly disappointed with this lighter. The first day out of packaging I noticed the lighter was a bit loose and not packaged firmly. Just as well, the flint wheel was tight and did not give way to my attempts at striking up a flame. The wheel was either too loose or too tight and as such the flint rock seemingly fell out. I was sitting there dumbfounded as to why there was no spark, and even now I cannot find the incredibly small flint piece. I know your company will most likely not care, but I just hope I get some sort or compensation because I don't like spending money on something I can't use or fails to meet my expectations even halfway. Thank you for listening to me ramble on much appreciated.

reviews.title: Reliable and Cheap!
reviews.body: I dont know why it wasnt lighting and then to find out it needs fluid right out of the box? No biggie though

author.name: ByAmazon Customer

reviews.title: Disappointed to say the Least.
reviews.body:
I bought this lighter on my friend's account with my card so it doesn't show up as verified. I received my Brushed Chrome Zippo along with x3 wicks, x3 packages of flints and 4oz Zippo lighter fluid on Friday Oct 14th 2016. Right on time. Shipping was fast !

I am satisfied with the lighter and seller. I'm giving 5 stars! My lighter is beautiful and works every time. In fact, I don't know why Zippos get a bad rep from some people .. I filled my lighter with Zippo brand fluid and did several light up test and it lights 10 even 20 times in a row with no misfires. I've also used my lighter to light 3 packs of cigarettes since last Friday and my lighter hasn't failed me yet or ran out of fuel. I'm using said Zippo as my everyday lighter!

I definitely recommend Zippos for people who don't mind having to refuel, change flints or wicks on their lighters occasionally. The seller is great no complaints.. I'm definitely buying more in the future to collect!

reviews.title: Doesnt Come with Fluid?
reviews.body:
For years I've scrimped on lighters, carrying disposable lighters in my backpack or my camping kit. I've seldom been let down by these cheap throw-aways, even when they've sat unused for months/years. I'm not a smoker - I bought this lighter for use around the house and around camp, but didn't anticipate using it all that often. I pictured it as an "every day carry" piece - if the need for fire arose, I would be ready!

Unfortunately, I was let down in the "reliability" department by Zippo - not by a malfunction in parts, but in design. The lighter is not a sealed unit - the fuel is free to evaporate away as the lighter sits unused. After 2 weeks or so a full dose of fuel will waft away, leaving the lighter useless. If you're an "every day" user, you may not notice; however, if you use it only occasionally you'll find yourself having to add fuel before each strike. Not the ideal tool for emergency or even occasional use.

That said, it functions beautifully when topped off. One strike and you've got a strong flame no matter what the wind or precipitation, and it'll stay lit long after your fingers tell you it's time to put it down! Everything fits together the way it should, and there is no "wiggle" in the hinge on my example. The thicker case of the "Armor" version clicks shut with a satisfying "clunk". I've never had a problem with (liquid) fuel leakage - though I stopped carrying mine after a few months due to the previously mentioned longevity issue.

author.name: ByCol. Sanders

reviews.title: Classic American Made Lighter For Everyday Use Or Collecting
reviews.body: Product was defective.

reviews.title: Not ideal for the "occasional" user
reviews.body: As far a Zippos go, this is a great lighter. I wanted to like zippos more than I do, they simply are not that great. I am not a smoker, and I just like to have a lighter hanging around so I can use it when I need it without having to refill without use. I knew what I was getting into. I think the only silver lining is the fact that it is windproof.  Other than that, you are better off with a bic. Sure it looks cool, but man is it annoying to have a dry lighter when you need it.  To each his own, but this guy is not for me.  I give the product five stars because it is great for what it is. Just not a good all around lighter. Keep that in mind.

author.name: BySandeep

reviews.title: One Star
reviews.body: there is only spark no fire.

reviews.title: Love It!
reviews.body: Many scratches on the product. Looks like it has been thrown around (not just used - and this is a brand new piece). Maybe a display piece - can't be too sure. Its just too low a price for me to bother sending it back. Not happy. Not what one associates with the Zippo brand.

reviews.title: Fluid evaporates rapidly, so it never lights when I want it too.
reviews.body: My dad was always a Zippo user and I got my love for them through him!  These lighters are easy to fill, replace flints and light in conditions that no other can.  I recently went swimming at the beach with my Zippo in my pocket.  Needless to say, no amount of drying out, new fluid or flint could save this lighter.  With Zippo's lifetime guarantee, I simply mailed it to the company and in a week, I had it back in new condition!  Not only are they durable and well made, but you can't go wrong with a Lifetime Guarantee!

reviews.title: Product has scratches
reviews.body: Bad product

author.name: ByJP

reviews.title: Lifetime Guarantee!
reviews.body: Perfect!! Except that I gotta refill it every week

reviews.title: One Star
reviews.body: Great lighter that I've been wanting to buy for some time. I do not smoke so could not justify the need for a zippo for a long time but with the amount of outdoor activity such as camping and hiking I do I thought a zippo would be the perfect addition to the backpack and it was. It lights every time and stays lit even in the wind. As part of one of the deals of the day this was a steal at $7.xx. I have not found anything negative about this lighter yet. Upon arrival I checked out a few YouTube videos and repacked the lighter before filling it with lighter fluid. Definitely a recommended buy.

author.name: ByThe Mrs.

reviews.title: Really the best lighter out there
reviews.body:
This is the most versatile finish I've experienced of many Zippo's. The chrome finish with the inlay work is beautiful yet hides any scratches which will form over years of usage compared to a glossy chrome Zippo. Had one and over time, the glossy finish ended up showing all the scratches and didn't have the great appearance it did when new.

Love this style and finish. As always, it's a Zippo so the performance and quality is just the same as the many other finishes. This one does have a little bit of friction due to the inlay work so, slippage out of your hands tends to be much less than the glossy finishes.

It's a keeper and a daily driver...get two or more for life.

reviews.title: Highly Recommend
reviews.body: The lighter portion of the zippo works incredibly well, the same way they always have. I am very underwhelmed by how thin and fragile the case is, however. I am not impressed by this in the slightest. My old zippo, which is by no means an armor zippo, is ten times tougher and the primary difference is that it was produced in 2003. Spare a few extra bucks for an armor zippo or buy an old one, because this thing does not have the toughness I am used to having behind the name zippo.

author.name: Byronald

reviews.title: Best Style Of Them All
reviews.body: The best lighter in the world and still made in the USA.  It is worth purchasing just to support a manufacturer that still chooses to manufacture his products at home. A great company. I also have a Zippo money clip, tape measure and pen. I support companies who still manufacture here instead of sending it to China. Thank you Zippo and I hope you are around for another 100 years.

reviews.title: Average
reviews.body: it looks nice, but my friend use it for several days, then it's broken, they may think a buy a fake one for them.

author.name: ByBryce

reviews.title: Made in the USA and unbeatable quality.
reviews.body:
I love Zippo's. Great quality, a classic design since the 1930's, proudly made in the USA, and a lifetime guarantee that they really honor, no questions asked.

Photo alert: Currently (7/14) Amazon has the wrong photo up. The photo looks to be Zippo's 'satin chrome' finish, which is an evenly sandblasted look, but this listing is the 'brushed chrome', which has obvious 'brush mark lines'. You can see the difference better on Zippo's website.

I like Zippo's "slim" models. They are each about 60% of the width of the standard Zippo, but the same height. They hold only about half the fuel of a regular size Zippo. So you'll need to fill them twice as often.
Not a big deal, but good to know up front.

It's a genuine Zippo, it's $11-$12 delivered, what's not to love?

Hope this is helpful as you comparison shop Zippo's. Happy trails, everybody.

reviews.title: Love It!
reviews.body: Bought this during a lightning deal for a great price.  It's your standard, do everything, durable Zippo.  It works, will last a long time, and is perfect for keeping around to light candles or for those occasions I need a lighter (fireworks, camping, etc).  Can't really go wrong with this.

reviews.title: Fluid evaporates rapidly, so it never lights when I want it too.
reviews.body: I know this Zippo says chrome but for a second I was almost certain it was platinum or genuine white gold, because it shimmers like glitter at a gay bar. I love it! I'm always opening and closing it to show my friends. I will say this, the fire on this thing is very hot. Not sure how they got the flame so much hotter than other flames, but if you're not akin to hot flames, then this is probably not for you. But if you're like the rest of America and you want you flames hot, your chrome glittery, and your success to be prominently displayed for all to see. Then this is the lighter for you.

reviews.title: It just works
reviews.body: I've had 3 Zippos in the past decade and this one is the worst of the three. Every time I flip this open, the inside case raises out of the bottom case. So after a couple of uses, I try to close the lid and the edge connects with the flint wheel and throws the flint wheel out of alignment. So now I have to push the inside case down about every 3-4 uses.

author.name: ByPAPASTAG

reviews.title: Make America great again
reviews.body:
The Zippo Satin Chrome Pocket Lighter is a good basic affordable lighter without all the bells and whistles of the more expensive designer labels. The satin chrome finish has a minor grainy touch which allow for a better grip than a glossy finish would. Zippo lighters just feels good in the hand and gives off a durable long lasting aura. Being made in the USA is a big plus.

I did have a minor struggle in getting the burning unit out of the enclosure, but I would prefer a snug fit that way as I wouldn't want the burner fall out and burn myself or someone else. In terms of fuel capacity, I would like for it to hold more but that would increase the size of a nicely compact lighter. The flip lid has that recognizable click sound as Zippo is known for and they've been around for decades, so that means they're doing something right.

Sadly, I found out the hard way that the fuel ends up being evaporated after a few days without use. There's no seal to prevent that from happening unless you mod it using a bicycle liner tubing.

reviews.title: Not the usual quality Zippo
reviews.body: When I put in the fluid and tried to light it nothin happened. No flame no spark. Would not buy again

author.name: ByJACOB AND SUMMER

reviews.title: Good standard basic Zippo lighter
reviews.body: This lighter is absolutely classic. Being my first zippo I didn't realize what actually went into owning one of these. I've been using standard bics, my entire life and only now do I realize how much of a waste of money that is. This lighter is so solid and well built that if you maintain it even slightly it will last you forever. The replacement flints, lighter fluid, and wicks are extremely cheap and will also last you quite awhile.

reviews.title: crap
reviews.body:
Genuin zippo lighters are great and last really well along with being easy to use and constructed well.

Zippo lighters come with a wick and flint already installed no matter what type you buy but no zippo will ever be pre filled as it is unsafe.

The refill flints, wicks and fuel are readily available from many sources and using genuine zippo products help to ensure the lighter last and keep clean.

The price of genuine zippo lighters vairys depending on the outside shell but basic silver plain types like this are an average price though they can be found cheaper.

Genuin zippo lighters are stamped on the base and ther are many generic products out there but if you use genuine zippo products you shouldnt be dissapointed with the quantity.

The working parts as in the pull out insert part are lfetime gauranteed along with at times the hinges however the case say if it is scratched up is not covered at all.

author.name: ByJonathan

reviews.title: my entire life and only now do I realize how much of a waste of money that is
reviews.body: This is not a great lighter. Sure, they were popular in WW2, and flicking it open is cool, but the truth is technology has moved on. This lighter is always out of fluid. It can't be used as a backup lighter because, like I said, its always out of fuel. Mine, will last about two weeks without any use before its dried up and useless. Sure, just refill it but I don't want a lighter that requires I refill it every time I want to start the fireplace. I have disposable bic lighters that are years old and still work just like new, don't waste your money just because your grandfather had one.

reviews.title: great lighter
reviews.body:
First off this was my second sterling zippo, but like my thirtieth zippo ever, I ordered a sterling non armor zippo,
I was two hundred bucks and had no weight to it. I was unsatisfied and I took a gamble on this one. The best lighter I have ever had, it's not only twice as heavy of a case as the other sterling models, but also be sure Not to get a polished one., the go to hell real quick. This brushed design is flawless after drops, tosses, misplacements, and heck a little abuse this lighter is still as nice as the day I purchased it. ( Be careful to not get polished unless you want crazy scratches overnight.

Cheers,
Sjp

author.name: ByV. Do

reviews.title: Always empty of fluid, not worth the money
reviews.body: I don't even smoke, yet decided to get a Zippo.  Besides being a piece of Americana, they're handy too.  Butane lighters are dandy, but I wouldn't call them reliable.  It seems like every time I need a lighter, I grab a dead one. I've even bought fancy refillable wick lighters that blow their seals when you actually try to fill them.  Zippo's are reliable, refillable and repairable. This lighter has worked every time I've asked it to and looked great doing it.

reviews.title: Love It!
reviews.body: A solid lighter. You' definitely have to care for it. I just had to take it apart and re-adjust the wick, but I rather enjoyed it, as it was a fun experience, seeing what was inside the lighter and what made it tick. The signature sound it makes when you open it is enough to buy it. Now I look cool whenever I'm lighting something up. The men envy me, the women want me. What more could you ask for? But yeah, the chrome finish does kinda get scratched up. So keep that in mind when you buy this lighter that puts your money into buying replacement wicks, charcoals, and lighter fluid :D

reviews.title: Fluid evaporates rapidly, so it never lights when I want it too.
reviews.body: As soon as I took it out of the package, I filled it with Zippo brand lighter fluid, but this thing just wouldn't light. I'd have to quickly spark it 25-30 times before it would light. I did this for a few days before it just quit sparking altogether. All in all, it was very annoying and barely worked, up until it just quit completely. First time I've ever had issues with a Zippo lighter, and I wouldn't buy this again.

reviews.title: but I rather enjoyed it, as it was a fun experience
reviews.body: First the shipping was quick and lighter brand new.  What a pleasure to use, quick and easy with very little effort.  So reliable and dependable. Remember not to over-fill with fluid. The fluid will run out and burn your skin if the lighter is over-filled.

author.name: ByChance

reviews.title: it was very annoying and barely worked
reviews.body:
I always wanted a zippo and bought myself the satin chrome lighter back in 2015. It was hard to light and I seldom use it. However, my dad recently gave me the zippo he bought in 1991 and it works extremely well. The Venetian engraving is beautiful, and the accumulated dents and scratches just give it character (they are very difficult to damage).
I'm a little wary of the newer lighters, but Zippo is a solid brand and their lighters are a neat piece of Americana.

reviews.title: Good old Zippo !
reviews.body: Impulse buy, had all the hallmarks of a real Zippo, and my everyday workhorse Armor was having problems making sparks. The wheel was becoming too smooth after nearly 20 years of use. I figured for around 10 bucks, if the inside parts would fit, I'd be good. The fit was perfect. As far as I can tell, it's the same insert used in all Zippos. Fueled up, a bit on the wick for luck, and the sparks were just as if from a new lighter (since it basically was). Not too worried about the case, but I can see how it's already random scratch pattern would be great for someone who needed a daily carry, and didn't care about the finish. It's in the junk drawer, not sure what to do with it. Maybe I'll end up with one with a broken hinge pin one day. Transfer the inner workings to this case. Solved.

author.name: ByAndrew Christiansen

reviews.title: The old lighters really hold up
reviews.body: Pin-striping seems a bit shallow. Mirror polish attracts smudges and fingerprints. Otherwise, it's good old Zippo. Nothing to complain about. I bought is just for the case as a host for Vector and Z-plus inserts. Zippo corporate: if you're reading this. Get in on the action of aftermarket inserts. I don't use the traditional flint-and-wick ones anymore. That's straight-up revenue loss since you're not tapping into the market.

reviews.title: Bought one hanging at a checkout line
reviews.body:
I have several of these and I beat them to hell. Like, no joke. This one is my absolute favorite for everyday use, because it does NOT show fingerprints or scratches, as it's finish is labeled "street chrome" for frequent use. Another made in USA favorite/classic from zippo.

THREE THINGS THAT WILL SURVIVE THE APOCALYPSE:

-Cockroaches
-Schwinn Varsity's
-Zippo lighters

author.name: ByRay-J

reviews.title: it's good old Zippo
reviews.body: not impressed

reviews.title: OLD RELIABLE
reviews.body: This is not the old Zippo.  Refills happen a lot more often with this than with the old Zippo.  The reason may be due to the construction.  The metal seems to be lighter and the fit between the lighter part and the case is not as good.  The new model has a raised portion around it in order to get a tight fit.  That might be the reason that a fill only lasts about 3 days.  That lip means that the actual body of the lighter is smaller than on the old model, so that is one reason the fills don't last as long.  Another is that the construction probably doesn't seal as tightly.

author.name: ByJasmine Liu

reviews.title: One Star
reviews.body:
It is a pretty good lighter. This is my first one so I am not up to date on Zippo's. I just got this one to fool around with, and smoke cigars, and it works great. It slides out of the case a little bit after about 20 strikes. But that isn't that big of a deal. The lighter fluid evaporates so use the fluid within 1 week-1 week and a half! The 4 OZ Zippo lighter fluid product will refill it about 8 times or more so it will last your 2 months or so (Sold Separately). Be sure to buy lighter fluid before you purchase this item, it does NOT come with lighter fluid (why would it???). This lighter is not a cheapy Bic, or disposable lighter, it is a lighter that can be used for 10 or even 20 years (with replacements of flints, wicks, and fluid of course). The wicks will last about 5 years (there is more in there then you can see, mostly folded in the Rayon balls, a synthetic cotton). The flints need to be replaces about every 2 weeks depending on how much you use it. And like I stated before, the fluid needs to be replaced every week. But it is a good lighter! I recommend it.

Fast shipping (as always with amazon).

Great products, never have defected items.

BUY IT

reviews.title: Love It!
reviews.body: This was not what we thought... maybe we just didn't read what we were ordering, but it didn't come with lighter fluid or directions on how to make it work.. we got it to work once & then never again.

reviews.title: Fluid evaporates rapidly, so it never lights when I want it too.
reviews.body: I'm not a smoker, so I bought the Zippo lighter for outdoor camping-type situations. The good news: it seems sturdy and the striker always creates a spark. The bad news: to make it work you have to fill it manually with lighter fluid. Then, within a couple of weeks, regardless of how you store it, the fluid evaporates, leaving you with a useless lump of metal. This is not really what I want to discover when I'm out in the field trying to light a fire... So if you are a smoker and will only use this at home and are prepared to re-fill the device every week, it will work fine for you. But if you need a reliable source of flame in more general circumstances, this is totally worthless and you should go for storm-proof matches and/or a cheap disposable plastic lighter because those somehow manage to retain their fluid reliably for years, instead of letting it evaporate over night.

reviews.title: This was not what we thought... maybe ...
reviews.body: I recently purchased a Satin Chrome Zippo from Walmart. It cost me $9.97. It didnt come with a box, but rather a shrink wrapped plastic on cardboard. The packaging is to be expected to cut costs. I did however start having problems with this lighter. The hinge was loose to begin with. Soon after I started having problems with the cap not shutting right. Not sure if I got a lemon, but I will probably send it into Zippo to get it looked at and repaired.

author.name: ByHeather & Tyler

reviews.title: Don't Count On It Working
reviews.body: I got my first zippo lighter the other day and I'm not one bit disappointed. I got it at Walmart for $9.97, which isn't a bad price for such a good lighter. All I did was get some Ronsonal lighter fluid for $2.99 (Also from Walmart) and I was set. It lights very easily and burns nice. I got this lighter to light of fireworks, and it works perfectly. The windproof feature on it is great, it works just like I expected. I really enjoy the silver finish on it as well. I definitely recommend it for the price.

reviews.title: To be expected for cost
reviews.body: I am 73 years old, and I remember my grandfather lighting his pipe with his zippo lighter. The smell of cherry maple tobacco and lighter fluid and the snap of a closing zippo, have many fond memories for me. For that reason, and made in the U S A, for the finest quality of product. I think Zippo is the very best that you can buy.

author.name: ByAllan M. Lees

reviews.title: Better Than I Expected!
reviews.body:
So I always wanted a Zippo lighter and even though I had stopped smoking months before the price on this I couldn't pass up while on sale.

There isn't much to say about a Zippo that hasn't been said before. I will say I quite enjoy the finish on this model. It reminds me of what WWII soldiers used.

The only complaint I have is at least with my model the fluid seems to run out after about a day or so without me even using it. Alas if you are in the market for a lighter you can't do much better for the price.

reviews.title: Best of all
reviews.body: I'll never us another lighter again!! This easily fits into your pocket but it's size and shape makes it easier to hold on to. The windproof feature makes this easy for me to use with my arts and crafts projects and easy to use outdoor even when the wind is blowing. The fluid last a long time and so does the flint so you don't have to bother with those often. It's easy to fill and easy to change the flint and easy to adjust the wick.

author.name: ByBrennen A.

reviews.title: Solid little lighter
reviews.body: My favorite lighter! I noticed that mine was a little loose making the lighter come out of the case whenever I would lift the cap, but a little google search showed me that extending the bottom portion of the lighter with pliers would keep it from sliding off the case. I also noticed that zippo lighters are prone to lighter fluids evaporating which I noticed from using my zippo lighter. It's not the sellers fault, but rather a flaw in the zippo lighter.

reviews.title: I'll never use another but this kind
reviews.body:
I bought my first zippo when I was eighteen, and over the years I have collected many models and finishes.
This is the one I keep going back to!
The brushed chrome is nice, without being easily marred like the high polish finish. I've carried one of these with me everywhere from work to deep woods camping, And they have never failed me.

author.name: ByGarrett

reviews.title: My favorite lighter! I noticed that mine was a little ...
reviews.body:
I got this because I am a fidget, I need something to do with my hands. So thinking this was more safe than a balisong so I got one. But after about 15 minutes of flipping the hinge broke and would not close properly.

This might make a good lighter (I did not even fill it) but for flipping I think it is overrated.

I returned it and now I am happy.

reviews.title: Love It!
reviews.body:
This zippo comes in a nice little box perfect for gifting. I bought this one for myself and another style as a present. This one(brushed chrome) comes exactly as you'd expect. No scratches, no dents. The lid works smoothly and it strikes great. A classic zippo.
Note it does not come pre filled. You'll need to go buy the fluid for it yourself. It's easy to fill.

reviews.title: Fluid evaporates rapidly, so it never lights when I want it too.
reviews.body: I had to buy a bottle of zippo lighter fluid because it had none in it and wouldn't light. But when I did I worked perfectly fine.

reviews.title: Exactly what you'd expect from a classic zippo
reviews.body: I can't say enough positive about Zippo lighters.  They are one of the few products made these days that will outlive you (with minor care and maintenance) and still work like it did the day you bought it.  It's also one of the few products in which the lowest-priced version works as well as a high-dollar version.  The basic brushed chrome lighter is perfect for everyday carry as it has no graphics to get marred in your pocket.  Plus, I'd much rather loose a plain-Jane lighter that I paid 10 bucks for than one that had sentimental value.

author.name: ByHatbox121

reviews.title: NO lighter fluid in it
reviews.body: One Star what???? This is for all you donks who get a zippo and cant figure out why it doesnt work right. I recently got an Armor Antique silver zippo. The think is a work of art. First thing I did I took the cotton wadding out. The wick is suppose to be snaked through the body of the lighter. It wasn't. Wasn't even close. wadding wadding. no wick. wadding wadding finnally wick all scrunched up at the top of the lighter. This wasnt going to work. You put the wick to the proper hieght. You snake it over to the side away from the wheel and flint tunnel. as soon as it is against the edge you one piece of cotton up there. Shove another then bring the wick back towards the wheel and flint tunnel. Shove some more cotton up there. Bring it back the other way. make it an S pattern. I even used an extra ball of cotton I stole from my wife. Don't tell her. So this thing is packed solid. More cotton means it hold more fluid. I get two to three weeks depending on how much I use my Zippo. Now to figure out what that hole is for inside the felt. The Zippo is the best lighter in the world. In the world! Clippers are pretty cool but.... IN THE WORLD ! ! ! !

reviews.title: The perfect lighter for daily use.
reviews.body:
I got this about 3 years ago. I own a few zippos, and have handled a few dozen, but this one is my favorite.

The weight of the all metal design (vs the matte picture designs) makes this zippo the best for flipping open/closed. It is smooth for tricks, and always makes a crisp opening noise. Despite abuse the top still lines up perfectly, whereas my matte zippo doesn't feel as rugged. The matte zippo's I've used all feel flimsier, don't flip as well, don't sound as crisp, and have repeated issues with the lid bending a bit.

The biggest caveat is that is gets lots of finger prints and scratches easily, but they just add character. If the finger prints and scratches would bother you a lot get something less shiny.

I read some people experiencing the lighter inside sliding up a bit (this make sit harder to open/close). I have this issue on my matte lighters, but I haven't seen it happen often on any of the full metal ones. I'm sure it can, it just doesn't seem to as often. My best advice is to just keep pushing it back down, but in general its just luck how snugly they fit. This is another reason I prefer the full metal over the matte.

author.name: ByZac Quiocho

reviews.title: BEST LIGHTER IN THE WORLD ! ! ! ! ONE STAR ! ! !
reviews.body: I purchased two of these. I just opened them, and to my dismay the quality wasn't up to par. The insides of the casing itself was beginning to corrode on both and there was an ugly scraping sound when I pulled the actual lighter out of the case, like there were grains of sand inside of it. Not what I was expecting, but I bought these for cheap to practice zippo tricks with so I'm not too upset. Just wasn't what I expected.

Soon after I started having problems with the cap not shutting right. Not sure if I got a lemon, but I will probably send it into Zippo to get it looked at and repaired.

reviews.title: It's a zippo
reviews.body:
I like it. Barely noticeable steel thickness difference, but acceptable. Hinge is really loose. Tried to tighten it like youtube vids, but to no avail. Hinge might be thicker steel as well.
Overall, good buy. I'll buy more.

reviews.title: Love It!
reviews.body: Very pleased, love the engraving

reviews.title: Fluid evaporates rapidly, so it never lights when I want it too.
reviews.body:
I like this zippo. Out of all my zippos, this one comes along when I wish to travel light or I have other heavy items to carry in my pockets. It doesn't hold as much fluid as my large ones, obviously, but it does the job of lighting things on fire.

I don't like that it does feel kind of chintzy because there's simply not as much metal to grab on to, and the hinge is slightly loose. The noise it makes is definitely a *click* as opposed to the classing *CLINK* that larger Zippos make. The lighter seems to give off a smaller flame as the fluid dries up at the end of a fill up, my large zippos do not exhibit this. They simply light the same as always, then when they're empty, they don't light at all. There's never a dead give away that they're low on fluid. This can be seen as either a good or bad thing i suppose. I also don't like that it doesn't last as long as I'd like it to. You would be wise to not take it on a 3 day excursion somewhere with no backup, even if filled to the brim. My 1941 replica can go for weeks without needing to be refilled, this one I simply don't trust like that.

All in all, I like it. For a day outing, or overnight 2 days. It doesn't see as much use as I thought it would since my 1941 replica is just...an amazing zippo, my absolute favorite. The textured black model is a close second just because it won't scratch and is super robust. But, for those days where I'm carrying my camera gear and a knife and small Leatherman in my pocket, change and all kinds of other crap, I definitely use it and it definitely comes in handy weight wise.

reviews.title: Five Stars
reviews.body:
I like the finish, but I didn't know that it wouldn't come in with any lighter fluid in it. Or it's just the one I got that has this problem?

Anyhow, I just ordered their lighter fluid for it, and it works great.

author.name: ByY. Li

reviews.title: It's a Zippo!
reviews.body:
It came quick and easy along with my Black Matte One. I prefer the textured designed ones just because they don't leave fingerprints but don't be mistaken, Its Brand New and very smooth and shiny. I could've gotten a Black Ebony instead of Matte but that would leave fingerprints. I want to start a collection of non shiny/plain Zippos. Candy Apple Red, Meadow, Cerulean, and Gold Dust. These all have textured designs so they all fit in together.

I would recommend any zippo for any reason. It's a hassle always buying disposable lighters over and over and they're not even flashy.

Anyways once I received it, I did a few tricks, put in some fluid and done! All working and in one piece, Easy!

Camping, Smoking, Casual use, doesn't matter. It doesn't hurt to have one.

(Please Purchase Fluid! it does not come with fluid and DON'T COMPLAIN! And fluid is also subject to evaporation so you probably need to refill it once or twice a month depending on how much you use it.)

reviews.body: I have heard how reliable Zippo lighters are so I purchased the kit that had the street chrome lighter, fluid, and extra flints.  I am very impressed with the quality and it lights every time.  It isn't terribly windproof but compared to some other "windproof" ones it surpasses other brands.  I like the street chrome because I actually use the lighter for backpacking, fishing trips, etc. and do not have to worry about banging up the outside.  I like it enough that I'm buying more for groomsmen for an up-coming wedding!

reviews.title: ... Christmas gift for my son and he was very happy. Refillable
reviews.body:
This is the classic Zippo-- the cover "snaps" open and closed, and once lit the wind will (almost) never blow it out. This is the classic model-- the brushed aluminum that was so common back in the 1960s-70s, when smoking wasn't yet frowned on (in restaurants!), the cigarette companies still could lie to us about cancer and get away with it, and no one had ever heard of second-hand smoke.

It still comes with a lifetime guarantee-- which probably means more, now that fewer people are using it to shorten their lives!

However, if you're looking to use this as a survival lighter then it's mirror-like finish could definitely come in handy. Fuel leaks/evaporation are a known issue, so look into the Thunderbird butane drop-in or the Diamond Super Tank.

reviews.title: Great Zippo at a great price...
reviews.body: At first I had trouble lighting them, but had overlooked the need to let them sit for 2 or more minutes after filling them, before trying to light them. Without giving the fuel sufficient time to diffuse throughout the absorbent batting, it will not ignite properly. I can tell that it has ignited by feeling for the radiating warmth within a minute of 10 seconds of holding a flame very close or in contact with the catalyst. Don't try to soak or light the catalyst though.

reviews.title: Love It!
reviews.body:
For those people complaining about the lighter, the Zippo brand and design has been around since 1940 at least. It would have disappeared with the advent of the butane lighter long ago if it had been a terrible design. The American GI swore by this brand in

WW11. They were dependable on the battlefield. They functioned in the foxhole or the open battlefield. Other brands didn't. That alone says something. I prefer this lighter to anything else. By the way, I have never purchased a lighter to look at! Mine is some 50 years old, and still works as well as the day I bought it. L.C.R.

reviews.title: Love It!
reviews.body:
I've used a Zippo lighter for many years. My current one is about 35 years old. They work forever, are rugged, have cheap consumable parts (fluid, flint, wick). Wick will last years, flints quite a while. Fluid needs refilling fairly often. My last bottle of fluid (Ronsonal---same company as Zippo now) was under 2.00 at WalMart.
You know, with tight suits, skinny ties and the "Don Draper" look coming back, this is just the lighter for you. Even if you don't smoke (I don't). I use mine to light other stuff (handwarmer, candles, gas grill, etc.) but you youngsters with the 60's attire can use them to light cigarettes for other people while you are out drinking martinis. How cool is that?

author.name: ByJ.

reviews.title: good
reviews.body:
It's a Zippo... for pocket change. The quality surpassed even my expectations, and I absolutely love it (I am a non-smoker, I bought it for the sole purpose of lighting my Zippo handwarmer with style!) The brushed finish is excellent, and resists scratching or showing signs of it.

Two drawbacks and potential dealbreakers for the uninformed:
* You can't throw this in a pack and expect it to light a month later. This goes without saying, as lighter fluid evaporates unlike a butane lighter. Think of this lighter as a fun machine and not a ready to go flame.
* The flame doesn't burn for that long -- probably ten minutes. This shouldn't be an issue if you are using it to light a handwarmer.

I put it in a sealed zip-loc bag and I only have to refill it every month or so.

For $10, unbeatable.

reviews.title: The Zippo Lighter is wonderful. It looks just like the picture and is ...
reviews.body:
Great lighter, hell zippo is synonymous with the idea of wick lighters.

That said for those transitioning from gas lighters to wick, beware:

1) these bad boys run out of fluid alot because they burn fast and some gas is bound to evaporate off the wick

2) when you're gassing the lighter, be careful not to let the lighter fluid wet the flint, or it wont work and you'll need to replace it. overfilling the lighter can saturate the cotton inside and allow lighter fluid to leek out the wick, so be careful.

Anyway these things are classy and I recommend them

reviews.body:
When I first received this lighter I was VERY pleased with how it looks. It has a scratched chrome finish, which gives it a rugged, yet classy feel. It lights very easily and can withstand even the strongest of winds. For the first two weeks, I found every excuse I could to use a lighter.

Not long after that, I found myself leaving it at home more and more. Therein lies the problem: As with all Zippos, the fluid chamber is not sealed. This results in the lighter fluid evaporating in a week or so. I would not suggest you buy this lighter unless you smoke or live in a very windy area.

author.name: ByJackie Paulson

reviews.title: great
reviews.body:
History, Class, & Fire!

This was my first Zippo lighter. Before this I sometimes carried matches and at other times carried the disposable bics, and still at other times had no fire starting device at all.

Now I carry this tiny lighter with me every day. I don't smoke, however I have the idea that a "man" should carry a lighter in order to offer a woman a light, if you can find anyone these days that the government still lets smoke. It's called having manners. Yes I could just have that bic brand, but I just don't want to be one of those losers carrying a 99 cent bic. I want something with class. I could have also chosen an electric ignition type of lighter too, but this is my only one, and I like old school technology.

Ok about the lighter - It's got a very strong put together feel to it. It's very solid. The cap flicks easily and comes back to where it should. The construction is very well done. And it's made here in the USA! (Hooray!)

One thing that I have learned is to keep it topped off; it's a small unit so the fuel goes quickly. I don't smoke but I do play with it a few times a day - hey I'm a guy and I like toys - so be sure to fill it at least once every day or so. I also think that it is not sealed like some more modern lighters so some of the fluid evaporates. Actually from time to time I do smoke cigars and this is a great lighter for that too.

I do often have problems getting it to light on the first flick. This is both from the flint and in part to the wick. I have gone to two dealers so far, and both have pulled up the wick, and I do have extra flint. So it's a bit like an old Jaguar (or an old other type of classic car) it does require a bit of maintenance. But it's fun and so classic.

The unit is very lightweight and thin. It fits easily into the front corner pocket in my jeans and does not make any unsightly bumps in my suit jackets. It has a classic iconic look to it, when I do get to light a cigar or cigarette it brings a great smile to the one getting lit. I am thinking of doing a small modification and that would be putting a clip on its side so I can slide it into my suit pocket and not have to dig down. In the same pocket I have a pen, a flashlight, and a knife that all have clips on them.

I would highly recommend this lighter to anyone. Please note I purchased this in a store and not from Amazon, but all of my purchases have been fine from Amazon and its half the price here!

So some ratings...
Style 10
Quality 10
Maintenance 5
Ease of use 7
Cool factor 10+

ok, i have seen alot of low rating reviews on almost every zippo, complaining about things like: ohhh it has scratches on it, or , there's no fluid in it, or , it runs out of fluid even if you dont use it, if you actually researched what you bought, you would know its actually ok, seeing as this zippo has a scratched pattern, its not "scratched" its the finish, they dont ship with fluid because its illegal, and they evaporate because they've been made the same way since the 1930s, and they're not airtight.
my rant is over

author.name: ByBrendan Patrick

reviews.title: History, Class, & Fire!
reviews.body:
Perhaps I was not informed but the lighter seemed "new" on the outside but upon closer inspection it really was not. I used a tissue to get the lighter out of the case only to find out that it was not even properly cleaned. The item had fingerprint smudges on it. That was the first issue I had. Fingerprint smudges was not the real reason I was not satisfied. The shell also had 2 dents on the left side of the lighter. Upon opening the lighter I found out that the inside of the lighter had scratches all over it. Perhaps this is my inexperience but isn't a "new" lighter supposed to have no scratches? The scratches are not even minor scratches, there are so many that it is hard to read the words on the side of it.

Overall, I was extremely disappointed in the quality of the lighter.

author.name: ByLe Van Cuong

reviews.title: Five Stars
reviews.body:
The Zippo, a near perfect tool, it needs no ornamentation, the iconic American lighter, "It works or we fix it free.(tm)"

75 years ago, a guy in Pennsylvania made a better lighter. Wind resistant, reliable, and sturdy. It doesn't need decoration, it works and its simplicity carries a stronger message than any decoration could deliver. Designed by an American, and made by an American company, it has been copied in thrid world countries, but Zippo is the real deal, accept no substitute.

The motto "It works or we fix it free (tm)" is no idle boast. My Zippo had been run over by a tank at Hohenfels in Germany. Zippo replaced it for free, no questions asked. This shows what it takes to break a Zippo, and how complete their dedication to this simple standard is.

Zippo, accept no substitute.

E. M. Van Court

reviews.title: Survival Gear
reviews.body: First off, I am not a smoker. I purchased this lighter because I have always been fascinated by the idea of a device capable of producing flame. I could easily have bought a cheap Bic or other disposable brand, but I prefer the simple elegance of the Zippo's timeless design. The surface is smooth, and very shiny. Unlike some cheap "chrome" products, this is genuinely shiny metal, not just a thin coat of silver paint over dull pewter. The spring-loaded latch keeping the case closed is well-balanced; a flick of the wrist opens it, but it stays closed on its own. As for the lighter insert, I was impressed with the simplicity of the design. The flint sparks easily, lighting the wick- at least, in theory. I was disappointed to discover that the lighter ships empty- that is, there is no fuel inside. I had to run out to the store and buy some lighter fluid to make it work. Other than that, the filling procedure was simple: the insert can easily be removed to add more fluid. My only complaint is that the wick is tightly woven into the cotton in the insert, so when the wick burns down you have to disassemble the entire thing to advance the wick (absent a pair of needle-nose pliers.) Overall, though, I am very satisfied with this product. I carry it around so I can hold it up at rock concerts, and so far it has not failed to light as long as I keep it fueled and maintained.

reviews.title: Not sure if I got a new one
reviews.body: Let me say right away that this isn't a lighter that you open and start using, and then throw away when you're done with it. If you want one of those, go get a Bic. This is a Zippo! Sure, you have to refill it some, (since it comes without fluid, and dries out after a few weeks) and you can mess up your wick easier than you can mess up a regular lighter, but that's kind of the point. You see, this is the kind of lighter that you're supposed to buy and actually care for, which is part of its charm. If you mess up the wick, grab some tweezers and some scissors and pull the wick up a little bit (its surprisingly long) and cut the wick to the desired length. If you use up your flint, go buy a new one (I think they're like 59 cents for 3 at Wal-Mart) and put it in yourself. And if you do manage to mess it up beyond easy repair, you can just mail it to Zippo, since they offer a lifetime warranty on this product. Past that, I don't think I know a lighter that's nearly as much fun to light. The flint wheel and flint are quality components, and the lighter stays lit without you having to hold some stupid plastic button to keep it that way (did I mention that there isn't a single plastic component in the whole lighter?). I don't know how well I've described the kind of warmth that seems to grow in you for your Zippo as time goes by (For example my friend still has one from 2003, so he's had a single lighter for 4 years), but I can only hope that I've piqued your interest enough to go invest the 10 or 15 bucks to have one. After all, the more people that buy Zippos, the cheaper they are for me!

author.name: Bymicrolin

reviews.title: Classic!
reviews.body:
I bought one of these in 1964 while I was in Air Force basic training for about $5. It had been a dear friend for many years. It provided great service until 1996 when it was lost out of a jacket pocket. It had been back to Zippo a few times for repair, mostly worn out hinges or hinge pins. Each time the lighter was repaired free and returned with new guts installed. The finish is not gauranteed and mine had been used so long that most of the chrome was worn off around the edges and some in the middle of the case. I found this wear to be sort of a record and history of all the places it had been with me. I was heart broken at it's loss.
It was definitely the most valued $5 I have ever spent. I just purchased several for gifts for my sons. I hope they will appreciate the longevity and quality I have enjoyed.

reviews.title: Nice lighter
reviews.body:
I wanted to like these so bad, but I just can't they don't work well and that's all there is to it.

I've owned several Zippos over the years and they have all had the same issue. For whatever reason sometimes they just won't light. Yes I've changed everything possible, flint, wick and I used Zippo brand fluid. So frustrating, I can't tell you how many times I've been left striking the damn wheel until my thumb hurts. I really don't understand the high rating for this one. At least a Bic will always light if there is fluid, and it's not broken ; can't say that for Zippos.

The only time Zippos seem to work is right when they're new or right after it was previously lit. It's really strange I've had the thing so soaked in fluid it was running out the wick and it still won't light. If you bring a flame to the wick it takes right off and will usually re-light well for a while. I don't get it but what good is an unpredictable lighter? These CANNOT be trusted for something like camping, trust me been there done that. They sometimes just refuse to light especially if it's cold or it hasn't been used in a day or so.

I guess they're designed for cigarettes where you are constantly lighting and extinguishing, they do work well enough that way. But leave it in your pocket for half a day or longer or let it get too cold and sometimes the b@stard will not light off.

I will say the Zippo museum in Bradford PA is worth a visit, plus you get a free new one if you send yours in.

reviews.title: Fluid evaporates rapidly, so it never lights when I want it too.
reviews.body:
If you are looking for a Zippo, chances are you want to do more than light a cigarette; you're probably getting this lighter to do tricks. If so, this is a good lighter to go with, it's a functional basic Zippo.

However, if you think you're going to be playing around with this thing for a while, you might seriously want to consider getting a slightly better looking one (perhaps black, or with a zippo logo) for a couple of extra bucks. I got this lighter last week, and am already in love with it and trick with it all the time; I already wish I had a fancier one to show off...

Also, remember this is a refillable ZIPPO lighter from which fuel dries over time if not used, HENCE IT COMES WITH NO FUEL FILLED(duh!). So do yourself a favor, and buy Zippo lighter fluid right now with the lighter and don't curse yourself later about having to pay shipping twice.

reviews.title: Love It!
reviews.body:
I needed this lighter because not for smoking but I'm calling my self experimental man (or scientific for mad scientist or whatever) and I like to burn things a lot (you guys will not going to believe that burning things can be really fun if you can find the well object to burn..)

Don't forget to buy Zippo Fuel and Flints too. My type of guy who just click and click to have fire just for fun needs flints well.

This seems to be cheapest lighter that I can find and function was much more worth than its price (as far as I see now, you know I don't need WWII lighter to burn something)

And just for tip for those who wants to play with this lighter

If you want to close the top like FANCY AND COOL WAY

(You know, don't close the top by hand but swinging like FLIPING)

HOLD THE TOP AND SWING THE BODY, NOT HOLDING THE BODY AND SWING THE TOP

It is because TOP IS VERY LIGHT (I think you know the why by now)

ALSO, SAME WAY, IF YOU WANT TO OPEN BY COOL WAY, HOLD TOP AND SWING THE BODY.

And This CAN be important, so listen.

SITUATION 1 : OH, I THINK UN-SCREW THIS SCREW AT BOTTOM OF BODY AND POUR MY FUEL IS RIGHT WAY!

ANSWER : NO, YOU THAT IS WHERE YOU PUT LITTLE VERY TINY FLINT, DON'T POUR THE FUEL OR YOU WILL MESS YOUR HELL OF DAY (If you un-screw the screw and just hit the top several times, flint will come out, just remember, I told you IT IS VERY TINY LIKE LITTLE ANT, don't think it is size of finger or something, I suggest you guys to disect the lighter, you will figure out how Zippo lighter works)

SITUATION 2 : WHERE THE HELL IS PLACE TO POUR FUEL? I ONLY SEE THE COTTON AT BOTTOM. OH, I THINK I HAVE TO POUR FUEL AT TOP!

(cotton is below the sponge that said 'PILL TO FILL' thing. Just in case you never knew)

ANSWER : THAT WOULD BE THE QUICKEST WAY TO MESS YOUR DAY, AND I WORRY THAT YOU MIGHT BE IN PRISON FOR ARSON.

I THINK YOU WOULD BE SURPRISE (whether or not, I surprised so...) YOU POUR YOUR FUEL INTO THAT COTTON AND LET IT GET WET

How do you know you well fed lighter the fuel? There will be one or two drop of fuel at top (were fire suppose to come out) if you well fed (I BELIEVE YOU FED LIGHTER WITH UP-SIDE-DOWN POSITION OR IF YOU DID THAT WAY THEN I BELIEVE GRAVITY IS TOWARD SKY OR SOMETHING, HOPEFULLY)

SITUATION 3 : OH MY GOD, MY LIGHTER WICK IS RUNNED OUT, I MUST PUT IT IN THE TRASH NOW

ANSWER : NO ZIPPO CAN USE FOR LIFE TIME (ACTUALLY ZIPPO GUARANTEES YOU THE LIGHT FOR LIFE TIME), IF YOU THINK WICK HAS BEEN RUN OUT (FUEL CHECK DONE, FLINT WORK, AND NOT FIRE HAS TO BE WICK), THEN JUST USE PINCETTE AND PULL OUT THE WICK FOR SUITABLE AND SENSIBLE AMOUT AND CUT OUT THE OLD WICK

I'm sure you can use it for life time without buying new wick, but Zippo is selling 'Zippo wick' too.

Changing wick of Zippo lighter is not that hard too.

Just un-screw the screw, remove 'PILL TO FILL' sponge, remove fuel cottons (It is not just bunch of cottons, it is just crushed in, cottons are like 5 pieces, and I suggest you to remember the sequence of cottons, you know, it is not new lighter at that time of moment, and you don't want to mess your fuel cotton look little WHATEVER shape)

and you will see the wick that is tangled at that the flint placement pipe

(It doesn't really matter how it looks, it is ok to put the wick in any shape you want, but it will be matter the shape of wick at where the fire comes out, you know, you don't want to mass up the wick where fire comes out to be like shape of cobra or horse dung)

Just use your sensitive brain and common sense to place the wick and re-crush in the cottons and re-put the 'PILL TO FILL' sponge back, and re-screw the flint spring thing and it is good to go again

I THINK I SOLVED ALL QUESTIONS now, JUST REMEMBER, LIFE TIME GUARANTEE AND YOU JUST CALL THEM AND QUEST THEM TO FIX, THEY WILL DO IT FOR FREE (OF COURSE YOU NEED TO BUY LITTLE POSTAGE-STAMP IN ORDER TO SEND, OR JUST WALK TO CLOSE ZIPPO SHOP, AND THEY WILL NOT CHARGE YOU A CENT FOR IT AND THEY WILL POST BACK TO YOU, OF COURSE FOR FREE)

When I fill it again, completely saturating the cotton reservoir and the same thing happen, with only 3 or 4 uses it runs out of fluid. I've tried under and over filling it and have done this a few times with no sustainable luck. The only thing I can think of is that this is a factory defect and it's leaking. BTW I have plenty of zippos that work just fine. I don't leave it in a car on a hot day. It is stored safely in my room. Guess I just got a bad one.

reviews.title: Not Impressive
reviews.body: I'd read consistently good things about Zippo lighters and wanted a no-frills lighter I could take on camping trips. The lighter arrived promptly and I filled it up with lighter fluid. It worked great, with a strong flame on the first click of the flint.  But... a few weeks later, it didn't work on an overnight camping trip. All the lighter fluid had evaporated from the storage compartment, despite the fact the lighter had been sealed in a ziplock container and not subjected to extremes of temperature. A few weeks earlier I'd filled it to capacity; now it was useless.  So I can't really give this product high marks for the use I intended it. If all you need is a household lighter and you have plenty of fluid on hand for refills, then it's OK.  Otherwise, it is a lighter that doesn't provide light and that's pretty useless.  Fortunately for my camping trip I had some REI storm matches that worked flawlessly. As far as fluid lighters are concerned, I think I'll stick to cheap disposable sealed units from now on.

author.name: Bydanny

reviews.title: Don't trust the Hat shark!
reviews.body:
1 star to counter all the raving 5 star reviews.

Zippos were great back in the day for reliability. But it's the 21st century - why settle for a lighter that can't hold its fluid for several months without it all evaporating away? Why settle for a lighter that doesn't even seal its lighter fluid in - that will leak its fluid (quite a bit) out the top and all over itself and your bag or pocket if it's tossed around at all?

I like the alternative inserts for the case, but then, you're paying as much for that insert as you'd be paying just for the empty "Zippo" case. And then you might even find you'll want to run Butane instead of Zippo's fluid so the Zippo fluid was a waste as well.

Nostalgia, yes. Practicality, REAL reliability and efficiency? No.

reviews.title: good but
reviews.body: When you buy a lighter, you assume that it will work right out of the box. However, apparently, in zippo's case, it does NOT. This zippo does NOT come with the fluid. Why? Because if it had included the fluid in the first place, the fluid would probably be gone by the time you receive your zippo because zippos are DESIGNED to lose their fluid in a very short period of time through evaporation. So, I guess the only reason people gave this lighter "5 star" is that it was made in the USA. I can't think of any other reason why it would receive 5 star. I hope my 1 star review will reach many many people so they don't waste their money on some junk.

reviews.title: One Star
reviews.body: This was not what I thought it would be.  It is very old fashioned.  I guess is you are ok carrying around flammable fuel in your pocket like your great grandpa did this is for you.  A friend of mine has a lighter just like this but it uses cool bolts of electricity instead of gasoline.  It was my fault, I did not look close enough at the discription.

reviews.title: Love It!
reviews.body: Upon opening the packaging I could tell right away this was not a new zippo. The chrome was all scratched up and the lighter looked like it had been used for a while. Even the inside was dirty. Not too impressed.

reviews.title: Fluid evaporates rapidly, so it never lights when I want it too.
reviews.body: I bought this seeing as it was a sweet deal. It turns out just to be a huge waste of money. It would set a spark, but the wick would not stay lit. This is a terrible item. Please, but a real Zippo, not this piece of junk.

reviews.title: Not so new
reviews.body: terrible won't even light. Will not buy again. Wish i could return but its not worth the hastle

author.name: ByJeff

reviews.title: Didn't stay lit.
reviews.body: Doesn't last for long.  A few times used before need a refill.

reviews.title: DONT BUY
reviews.body: Revived it and then it broke after a few hours

reviews.title: bad
reviews.body: now is Dec 11 I still do have my zippo it suppose  be here in December 4 that was 7 days ago  OMG I'm disappointed

reviews.title: horrible
reviews.body: We bought this lighter for when we go camping and backpacking. We were were very disappointed in this product. The lighter fluid is not included with the product. Also, when you fill with lighter fluid it evaporates very quickly. This is such a shame because we bought this product because we thought that the quality was good. I was also surprised to see that the lighter got such good reviews. Overall, poor product.

author.name: ByJosie

reviews.title: take forever
reviews.body: So, I did not find out the lighter fluid was sold seperately until I had received it. Extremely disappointing and dumb, this is a rip off.

reviews.title: Waste of money
reviews.body: I got this hoping it would be good. I only used it 3 times and it just stopped working and I don't know what to do.

author.name: ByBciloveyou

reviews.title: Sold Seperately
reviews.body: Disappointed that Amazon would sell an aid to cancer.  What relly bothers me is that you smokers will ultimately come down with a smoking related disease and expect us to pay for it.  Keep on smoking....it helps with overpopulation.
